The tag-releases job does not log under the "cover" directory, so
there's no need to try to copy those files to the log server.

commit_message:
collect-logs: run in two stages

We should run and publish a minimal sets of files even without any host,
when we failed the run before inventory generation.

This change separates the collection step that runs on all hosts except
localhost, and the rest running on localhost. Running on localhost
always succeeds, even with an empty inventory.

Also add a log environment file for local collect-logs.sh runs that
does not upload logs.

Change-Id: I48d07d42be879026fb80afd73835484770006f85

commit_message:
[ci] stop checking verification component

We are planning to redesign verification component and it will include a lot
of changes in code. To simplify review process, such changes should be
splitted as much as possible.

Current jobs will not work with new code, so we will need to rewrite them too.
To reduce workarounds(they will require a lot of additional lines of code), it
would be nice to temporary disable checking verificaiton component at all and
enable them again after redesign will be done.

Change-Id: Id9d85f9f9d4607acdd562dfca47ecca5dbeb9bff

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-06 18:17:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/db/test_connection_switch.py', 'nova/tests/fixtures.py'], 'message': "Add a CellDatabases test fixture

As we progress with the Cells v2 scheduling interaction work, we need
to be able to have switching between multiple databases work in our
functional tests. The existing Database fixture doesn't work in this
case because each connection switch via target_cell results in a new,
empty sqlite database, and main_context_manager is global in the DB
API and always points at the same sqlite database.

This adds a fixture that creates a new sqlite database per cell
database, runs migrations, and keeps track of the databases using
identifiers provided when cell databases are added to the fixture.
It patches get_context_manager, create_context_manager, and target_cell
to return the matching database connection according to identifier,
simulating switching between multiple databases in a single test.

Change-Id: I00748cbbb682813987a2ad8c69948f71223daee7
"}]
commit_message:
Add a CellDatabases test fixture

As we progress with the Cells v2 scheduling interaction work, we need
to be able to have switching between multiple databases work in our
functional tests. The existing Database fixture doesn't work in this
case because each connection switch via target_cell results in a new,
empty sqlite database, and main_context_manager is global in the DB
API and always points at the same sqlite database.

This adds a fixture that creates a new sqlite database per cell
database, runs migrations, and keeps track of the databases using
identifiers provided when cell databases are added to the fixture.
It patches get_context_manager, create_context_manager, and target_cell
to return the matching database connection according to identifier,
simulating switching between multiple databases in a single test.

Change-Id: I00748cbbb682813987a2ad8c69948f71223daee7

subject: ISA-L Cauchy support
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-02 01:20:03.000000000', 'files': ['test/test_pyeclib_api.py', 'test/test_pyeclib_c.py', 'pyeclib/ec_iface.py', 'src/c/pyeclib_c/pyeclib_c.c'], 'message': "ISA-L Cauchy support

This is for supporting ISA-L cauchy based matrix. The difference
from isa_l_rs_vand is only the matrix to use the encode/decode
calculation.

As a known issue, isa_l_rs_vand backend has constraint for the
combinations of the available fragment to be able to
decode/reconstuct. (See related change in detail)

To avoid the constraint, this patch adds another isa-l backend to use
cauchy matrix. The reason I try to add this intead of changing at
sa_l_rs_vand, the isa_l_rs_vand backend may be already used and if we
change the matrix, the current users won't be able to decode the data.

To avoid the problem and keep the backward compatibility, this is in
another isa_l_rs_cauchy namespace.

NOTE: this depends on tag may be meaningless because the depending target
is a c lang project so probably no scripts to install it we have and then,
almost of the tests for isa-l will be skipped due to a lack of isa-l
backend installation.

Related-Change: Icee788a0931fe692fe0de31fabc4ba450e338a87

Depends-On: I6eb150d9d0c3febf233570fa7729f9f72df2e9be

Change-Id: I3a5516545d17ab7ac67a9a3627c85243e2110764
"}]
commit_message:
ISA-L Cauchy support

This is for supporting ISA-L cauchy based matrix. The difference
from isa_l_rs_vand is only the matrix to use the encode/decode
calculation.

As a known issue, isa_l_rs_vand backend has constraint for the
combinations of the available fragment to be able to
decode/reconstuct. (See related change in detail)

To avoid the constraint, this patch adds another isa-l backend to use
cauchy matrix. The reason I try to add this intead of changing at
sa_l_rs_vand, the isa_l_rs_vand backend may be already used and if we
change the matrix, the current users won't be able to decode the data.

To avoid the problem and keep the backward compatibility, this is in
another isa_l_rs_cauchy namespace.

NOTE: this depends on tag may be meaningless because the depending target
is a c lang project so probably no scripts to install it we have and then,
almost of the tests for isa-l will be skipped due to a lack of isa-l
backend installation.

Related-Change: Icee788a0931fe692fe0de31fabc4ba450e338a87

Depends-On: I6eb150d9d0c3febf233570fa7729f9f72df2e9be

Change-Id: I3a5516545d17ab7ac67a9a3627c85243e2110764

commit_message:
Add print_empty parameter

TableFormatter doesn't allow to print empty table anyway.
To allow this feature was added optional parameter --print-empty.
By default, it's set to False and in this case if there is no data
to show then emit_list() will print nothing. Otherwise, empty table
will be printed. Appropriate unit test was added.
This solution doesn't affect existing approaches to use cliff.

Change-Id: I0e69f1cbcdd5b1280ea9d4d1523df29381cc349d
Closes-Bug: #1642263
Signed-off-by: Ruslan Aliev <raliev@mirantis.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-05 21:37:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/hypervisors.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_hypervisors.py'], 'message': "Handle ComputeHostNotFound when listing hypervisors

Compute node resources must currently be deleted manually
in the database, and as such they can reference service
records which have been deleted via the services delete API.
Because of this when listing hypervisors (compute nodes), we
may get a ComputeHostNotFound error when trying to lookup a
service record for a compute node where the service was
deleted. This causes the API to fail with a 500 since it's not
handled.

This change handles the ComputeHostNotFound when looping over

commit_message:
Handle ComputeHostNotFound when listing hypervisors

Compute node resources must currently be deleted manually
in the database, and as such they can reference service
records which have been deleted via the services delete API.
Because of this when listing hypervisors (compute nodes), we
may get a ComputeHostNotFound error when trying to lookup a
service record for a compute node where the service was
deleted. This causes the API to fail with a 500 since it's not
handled.

This change handles the ComputeHostNotFound when looping over
compute nodes in the hypervisors index and detail methods and
simply ignores them.

Change-Id: I2717274bb1bd370870acbf58c03dc59cee30cc5e
Closes-Bug: #1646255

When we were tagging releases by hand, sometimes the tag was applied

commit_message:
if a release has been tagged, stop processing it

When we were tagging releases by hand, sometimes the tag was applied
before any of the other processing was done. Now that all cycle-based
projects are using the release automation, we can skip updating
launchpad and the requirements repo if a release already exists.

Change-Id: I7c4a2c51dcba073b5b6d29ddf58fff1cb3f11055
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Disable API query when unit is paused

When the unit is paused the charm should not attempt to run
update_all_identity_relation_units because it depends on the
Keystone API being available.

Closes-Bug: 1648016

Change-Id: I58fc0639791eed16c11ec836746e912e715588d9

commit_message:
conf: Remove deprecated service manager opts

The following service manager config options were deprecated in
13.0.0 and remove them now:

- metadata_manager
- console_manager
- consoleauth_manager
- cert_manager
- scheduler_manager
- conductor.manager

Implements: bp centralize-config-options-ocata

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia50d18c350dbc4ca88da9543e1236e3398ea28ee

commit_message:
Specify snapshot size when creating volume

To avoid volume creation failures due to the default size being
insuficient, specify the snapshot size when creating a volume
from a snapshot.

Closes-Bug: #1645816

Change-Id: Ib609bac7ab331a7ddf90e3d9147547658ec1b0f7

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-12-02 07:00:24.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Improve _is_booted_from_volume implementation

Currently this method cannot be used widely due to its parameters. It
requires device_info - the dict which can not be easily obtained in many
cases. Since it is often needed to figure out if an instance is booted
from volume, and the method name is "appropriate", this sometimes leads
to errors (when string result of get_instance_disk_info is passed as an
argument to _is_booted_from_volume; see also Id5901254).

This patch makes _is_booted_from_volume to use standard
block_device_info structure, which is accessible in almost any driver
method.

Closes-bug: 1596957
Closes-bug: 1587802
Change-Id: Ie424d172ac9d6aeb42d83e512f2a18713134be3b
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Improve _is_booted_from_volume implementation

Currently this method cannot be used widely due to its parameters. It
requires device_info - the dict which can not be easily obtained in many
cases. Since it is often needed to figure out if an instance is booted
from volume, and the method name is "appropriate", this sometimes leads
to errors (when string result of get_instance_disk_info is passed as an
argument to _is_booted_from_volume; see also Id5901254).

This patch makes _is_booted_from_volume to use standard
block_device_info structure, which is accessible in almost any driver
method.

Closes-bug: 1596957
Closes-bug: 1587802
Change-Id: Ie424d172ac9d6aeb42d83e512f2a18713134be3b

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-17 00:35:23.000000000', 'files': ['solumclient/common/apiclient/fake_client.py', 'solumclient/common/apiclient/base.py'], 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates
to __eq__ and inverts the result, but in
Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when
you define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].
There are no implied relationships among the
comparison operators. The truth of x==y does
not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when
defining __eq__(), one should also define __ne__()
so that the operators will behave as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I35754a3e31d7898a75deceefe057a37a4153daeb
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates
to __eq__ and inverts the result, but in
Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when
you define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].
There are no implied relationships among the
comparison operators. The truth of x==y does
not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when
defining __eq__(), one should also define __ne__()
so that the operators will behave as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I35754a3e31d7898a75deceefe057a37a4153daeb

commit_message:
Fix for failing kombu gate

Mysql is rounding the microseconds to one second,
which leads to time inconsistency beetwen what
is returned to cllient and what is stored in the DB.
This patch changes the behaviour, so that no mircoseconds
gets genereated.

Closes-bug: 1644881

Change-Id: I514c1d5154b3c658ec74c88b800d2a3ded1fdad9

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-02 17:13:24.000000000', 'files': ['doc/kibana-guide.rst'], 'message': 'Update Kibana documentation

Simplify some of the Kibana docs, and add some more detailed information
on searching logs.

* Add a summary of what Kibana is

* Make it easier to see how to access Kibana (e.g. say port 5601 instead
  of <kibana_server_port>)

* Add note how to enable Kibana via centralised logging

* Expand the search section with an example.

Change-Id: Ia01e2b52fa758eb45fa417da7c6622150b2d5156
'}]
commit_message:
Update Kibana documentation

Simplify some of the Kibana docs, and add some more detailed information
on searching logs.

* Add a summary of what Kibana is

* Make it easier to see how to access Kibana (e.g. say port 5601 instead
  of <kibana_server_port>)

* Add note how to enable Kibana via centralised logging

* Expand the search section with an example.

Change-Id: Ia01e2b52fa758eb45fa417da7c6622150b2d5156

commit_message:
Fix db.deployment_update

In current implementation deployment_update erases
credentials if we try to update deployment status or
anything else.

This patch moves credential creation logic from db api
to Deployment object.

Change-Id: Iefe5f3f3913d1c28b23ef257c73a4853e66d5291

subject: Use absolute path when handling missing files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-01 10:26:58.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': "Use absolute path when handling missing files

When we try to handle rendered files in the environment, we create a
whole new env file copying the resource registry. As the file is in a
new location, we need to reference files with absolute directories, as
relative directories won't point to anything.

Change-Id: I19abb1ef8a003e45f414ba86e1dc763789c0b86f
Closes-Bug: #1640324
"}]
commit_message:
Use absolute path when handling missing files

When we try to handle rendered files in the environment, we create a
whole new env file copying the resource registry. As the file is in a
new location, we need to reference files with absolute directories, as
relative directories won't point to anything.

Change-Id: I19abb1ef8a003e45f414ba86e1dc763789c0b86f
Closes-Bug: #1640324

subject: Add optional checks for many more asserts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-26 10:05:20.000000000', 'files': ['hacking/tests/test_doctest.py', 'setup.cfg', 'hacking/checks/except_checks.py'], 'message': "Add optional checks for many more asserts

In '7c360d2', a check for 'assertIs(Not)None' was added. However, there
are many more assert types that nova checks for that would be beneficial
for other projects to use. Add these into hacking, so that they can be
both used by other projects and removed from nova.

Change-Id: I13be72e5e1d7b0a14033bab387081fd32f2006f2
"}]
commit_message:
Add optional checks for many more asserts

In '7c360d2', a check for 'assertIs(Not)None' was added. However, there
are many more assert types that nova checks for that would be beneficial
for other projects to use. Add these into hacking, so that they can be
both used by other projects and removed from nova.

Change-Id: I13be72e5e1d7b0a14033bab387081fd32f2006f2

commit_message:
Cleanup plugin links upon a cluster reset

Currently plugin links survive cluster reset and there is no way to get
rid of them. Cluster reset seems like a reasonable place to get rid of
them.

Change-Id: Id88c54b34a162881c6662ee1acb6090d4fee3fae
Closes-Bug: #1578700

subject: Restrict version of webmock
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-07 09:05:46.000000000', 'files': ['puppet-openstack_spec_helper.gemspec'], 'message': 'Restrict version of webmock

Version of webmock has been restricted to < 2.3.0.
Versions 2.3.0 and above require ruby > 2.0, but we have 1.9.
That fix issues with gate-puppet-aodh-puppet-beaker-rspec-ubuntu-trusty

Change-Id: Ib1c8470594fee351852e54c84295c1f6e34b68fd
'}]
commit_message:
Restrict version of webmock

Version of webmock has been restricted to < 2.3.0.
Versions 2.3.0 and above require ruby > 2.0, but we have 1.9.
That fix issues with gate-puppet-aodh-puppet-beaker-rspec-ubuntu-trusty

Change-Id: Ib1c8470594fee351852e54c84295c1f6e34b68fd

commit_message:
Strip prefix `migrate_` in parameter `migrate_engine`

This code was initially taken from Nova migrate_repo, the prefix of
'migrate_' in argument 'migrate_engine' makes no sense in this place,
but a little misleading. So we should strip the prefix and use 'engine'
instead.

Change-Id: I6460eca03eb135c98d22d066b57b17907df7237c

subject: Let the bgp_plugin to query floating IP bgp next_hop
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 4187, 'name': 'Ryan Tidwell', 'email': 'rtidwell@suse.com', 'username': 'ryan-tidwell'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 7448, 'name': 'Carl Baldwin', 'email': 'carl@ecbaldwin.net', 'username': 'carl-baldwin'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9531, 'name': 'liuyulong', 'display_name': 'LIU Yulong', 'email': 'i@liuyulong.me', 'username': 'LIU-Yulong'}, {'_account_id': 14605, 'name': 'vikram.choudhary', 'email': 'vikschw@gmail.com', 'username': 'vikram.choudhary'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-11-30 18:28:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_dynamic_routing/services/bgp/bgp_plugin.py', 'neutron_dynamic_routing/db/bgp_db.py', 'neutron_dynamic_routing/tests/unit/db/test_bgp_db.py'], 'message': 'Let the bgp_plugin to query floating IP bgp next_hop

When a dvr floating IP is associated to a port, the bgp plugin
`floatingip_update_callback` will immediately send a notification
`start_route_advertisements` to DR agent, there is a new floating
IP bgp route.
But this bgp route is not correct, its next_hop is set to dvr router
snat gateway IP address. And then after `periodic_interval` seconds,
the DR agent will resync that DVR fip route with new next_hop to the
correct FIP namespace fg-device IP address.

This patch will let the bgp_plugin to handle the floating IP bgp route
next_hop query.

Change-Id: Ic6bb7f4263c6e2da315178be2ed041eb7020c905
Closes-bug: #1615919
'}]
commit_message:
Let the bgp_plugin to query floating IP bgp next_hop

When a dvr floating IP is associated to a port, the bgp plugin
`floatingip_update_callback` will immediately send a notification
`start_route_advertisements` to DR agent, there is a new floating
IP bgp route.
But this bgp route is not correct, its next_hop is set to dvr router
snat gateway IP address. And then after `periodic_interval` seconds,
the DR agent will resync that DVR fip route with new next_hop to the
correct FIP namespace fg-device IP address.

This patch will let the bgp_plugin to handle the floating IP bgp route
next_hop query.

Change-Id: Ic6bb7f4263c6e2da315178be2ed041eb7020c905
Closes-bug: #1615919

not being appended.

This patch fix this job.

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated Stack.resolve_static_data() method

This method was left behind after the creation of the Function class and
resulting changes to function resolution in the Juno cycle, for the benefit
of any third-party plugins that may have been relying on it. It's time to
get rid of it.

Change-Id: Ia4700336f27ab259d25de9fd4a061c95198adf57

subject: Remove support for accessing ResourceDefinition like a dict
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-14 23:36:55.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_rsrc_defn.py', 'heat/engine/rsrc_defn.py'], 'message': 'Remove support for accessing ResourceDefinition like a dict

Heat no longer accesses resource definitions as if they were snippets of a
CloudFormation template, but rather uses the APIs of the ResourceDefinition
class. The ability to treat this class as a snippet of CloudFormation
template has been deprecated for several release cycles to allow
third-party plugins to move away from it; this change removes that ability.

Change-Id: Ia9c63662438d4c979b897118b3a7a736161bcbca
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for accessing ResourceDefinition like a dict

Heat no longer accesses resource definitions as if they were snippets of a
CloudFormation template, but rather uses the APIs of the ResourceDefinition
class. The ability to treat this class as a snippet of CloudFormation
template has been deprecated for several release cycles to allow
third-party plugins to move away from it; this change removes that ability.

Change-Id: Ia9c63662438d4c979b897118b3a7a736161bcbca

subject: Add DeprecationWarning in test environments
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-12-07 05:59:35.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.
To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we
enable them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

This copy from 1be35ff039d67c50866f2556ef847b048cbf3578

Change-Id: Ibe67b6b57494d731b49e76c590ac2681ae786c33
'}]
commit_message:
Add DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.
To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we
enable them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

This copy from 1be35ff039d67c50866f2556ef847b048cbf3578

Change-Id: Ibe67b6b57494d731b49e76c590ac2681ae786c33

commit_message:
Adds Tempest scenario test for networking-bgpvpn

This patch adds a scenario test that creates an l3 VPN and
assigns two neutron networks/subnets to it. Two nova VMs are
spun up on each network. To verify that the VPN is functional,
i.e., forwards traffic between the two subnets, one of the
VM pings the other one.

Change-Id: Ic38aab48fa364ad53ef061566fe5ebc1a46fec33
Closes-Bug: #1637489

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-12-02 07:00:24.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Delete duplicate check when live-migrating

A year ago a useless check was added: I7989128d

The above patch was aimed to enable live-migration when
instance is booted from volume and has not local disk
by adding a new check.

However, the same check has been already checked in
_is_shared_block_storage method.

The last part of the _is_shared_block_storage method does
the same that above patch does:
- check whether the instance is booted from volume
- check whether the instance has not a local disk

Also this check calls _is_booted_from_volume incorrectly.
Parameter disk_mapping of _is_booted_from_volume must be a dict, but
this check specifies a string instead.

And finally introduced _has_local_disk method is wrong, because
it does not take into accont disk.ephN names.

This change reverts I7989128d, improves and simplifies related tests.

Closes-Bug: 1598661
Related-Bug: 1469006
Co-Authored-By: Feodor Tersin <ftersin@hotmail.com>
Change-Id: Id59012547c3318d94b65ab9f7c37c33c3a08b0e0
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Delete duplicate check when live-migrating

A year ago a useless check was added: I7989128d

The above patch was aimed to enable live-migration when
instance is booted from volume and has not local disk
by adding a new check.

However, the same check has been already checked in
_is_shared_block_storage method.

The last part of the _is_shared_block_storage method does
the same that above patch does:
- check whether the instance is booted from volume
- check whether the instance has not a local disk

Also this check calls _is_booted_from_volume incorrectly.
Parameter disk_mapping of _is_booted_from_volume must be a dict, but
this check specifies a string instead.

And finally introduced _has_local_disk method is wrong, because
it does not take into accont disk.ephN names.

This change reverts I7989128d, improves and simplifies related tests.

Closes-Bug: 1598661
Related-Bug: 1469006
Co-Authored-By: Feodor Tersin <ftersin@hotmail.com>
Change-Id: Id59012547c3318d94b65ab9f7c37c33c3a08b0e0

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-30 22:00:26.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_middleware/catch_errors.py', 'oslo_middleware/tests/test_catch_errors.py'], 'message': 'Filter X-Auth-Token in catch_errors

If X-Auth-Token is logged in files, it may be caught by attackers.

Change-Id: Icf0cd9d4da37575d79a0da94ade979793ad0d3fa
Closes-Bug:#1646254
'}]
commit_message:
Filter X-Auth-Token in catch_errors

If X-Auth-Token is logged in files, it may be caught by attackers.
This patch tries to replace token-id by * in log files.

Change-Id: Icf0cd9d4da37575d79a0da94ade979793ad0d3fa
Closes-Bug:#1646254

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-01 09:20:43.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/objects/volume.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_volume.py'], 'message': "Swap volume type for migration started by retype

Currently, while finishing migration, volume type is skipped while
swapping source and destination fields, but for the circumstance of
retype, this'll make the migrated volume doesn't have the correct
volume type info.

This patch fixes this bug.

Change-Id: I8906e2e7438617fb29c7632d993cede44e952036
Closes-Bug: #1597247
"}]
commit_message:
Swap volume type for migration started by retype

Currently, while finishing migration, volume type is skipped while
swapping source and destination fields, but for the circumstance of
retype, this'll make the migrated volume doesn't have the correct
volume type info.

This patch fixes this bug.

Change-Id: I8906e2e7438617fb29c7632d993cede44e952036
Closes-Bug: #1597247

commit_message:
Incremented MySQL to 5.7 for Ubuntu

- mysql default version is 5.7 on Ubuntu 16.04
- included mysql devel headers for mysql2
- incremented mysql cookbook to 8.0
- incremented database cookbook to 6.0
- pinned mysql2 gem at 0.4.4

Depends-On: I57c8729e8732161ac34caa85259de8264e99c56d
Implements blueprint newton-xenial

Change-Id: I8ee882d5b154ec0d319e6c4186ebf9f8ae68f269

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 09:09:00.000000000', 'files': ['etc/ceilometer/event_pipeline.yaml'], 'message': 'Enable event-alarm feature

Publish event messages from notification agent to
"alarm.all" queue. It is safe for our case because in MOS we
always run alarm-listener if Ceilometer is enabled service and
this guarantees that "alarm.all" queue will have consumers.

Change-Id: I858079003b4b359814f9e292d080d7fd361017a8
Fixes-bug: 1647996
'}]
commit_message:
Enable event-alarm feature

Publish event messages from notification agent to
"alarm.all" queue. It is safe for our case because in MOS we
always run alarm-listener if Ceilometer is enabled service and
this guarantees that "alarm.all" queue will have consumers.

Change-Id: I858079003b4b359814f9e292d080d7fd361017a8
Fixes-bug: 1647996

commit_message:
Update ctlplane network range to use 192.168.24.0

Per instack change I1393d65ffb20b1396ff068def237418958ed3289
(git commit a38b0adfcbc0bf2a713101cbb33b563fb978c416) we
now default our network range on the Undercloud to 192.168.24.0.

This change updates the docs to follow suite which gives a better
chance for these examples to work out of the box with stock
instack environments.

Change-Id: I3d4cde016786903d32508ba7bc6fdd0d756df821

subject: Fix tempest-dsvm-layer4 job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 09:39:20.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix tempest-dsvm-layer4 job

I5b60422bf1f5fa78aa8f3383f7a222e0356d9e42 removed heat code from
devstack tree. But the tempest-dsvm-layer4 job was relying on that
code and using Heat devstack plugin. Now the job is broken and so
is Tempest gate.

This makes the tempest-dsvm-layer4 job use the proper Heat devstack
plugin.

Change-Id: Iead6a6965009f0cf88ee729707610616d812d651
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tempest-dsvm-layer4 job

I5b60422bf1f5fa78aa8f3383f7a222e0356d9e42 removed heat code from
devstack tree. But the tempest-dsvm-layer4 job was relying on that
code and using Heat devstack plugin. Now the job is broken and so
is Tempest gate.

This makes the tempest-dsvm-layer4 job use the proper Heat devstack
plugin.

Change-Id: Iead6a6965009f0cf88ee729707610616d812d651

commit_message:
Use local memcached for keystonemiddleware in nova

In order to increase nova performance after failover,
we need to point nova to local memcached instance for keystone tokens

Change-Id: Ibd9ce480201685e4ff92e87490f5beff49272e87
Closes-Bug: #1621541
(cherry picked from commit f1022e3222b4a21821dcdbb302ce12a34711b1ad)

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-23 17:08:45.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/functional/test_ovn_db_sync.py', 'networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/ovn_db_sync.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/commands.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_ovn_scheduler.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/ovsdb/test_impl_idl_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/l3/l3_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/fakes.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance about
list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I23a273d6e84f4046787a7dadf4691b6d5a9c3f75
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance about
list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I23a273d6e84f4046787a7dadf4691b6d5a9c3f75

commit_message:
Update deprecated references to heat in tripleo.sh

This patch removes the references to heat stack commands.

There is no need anymore for the openstack snippet
or any other workaround when deploying as
we dont support liberty anymore.

From now on we can use the openstack stack [option] commands.

Change-Id: I731f2e6294d211c77a3d1bd3311616a5f8e4e2a0

commit_message:
Add create cluster action

This patch adds Create cluster action and
this patch is using angular-schema-form.
Other actions will be added in subsequent patches.

To test, set 'clusters_panel': True in 'ANGULAR_FEATURES'.

Change-Id: Id58c8e981459a4f59af72b467a50457dbeb01f14
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-cluster-table

commit_message:
Replace functions 'Dict.get' and 'del' with 'Dict.pop'

Refactoring code: Making dicts to use single instruction: pop()
rather than two instructions: get() and del, giving the codes a format
that carries through.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Iee49894ef41bd89caec5b79b2f50e71b053a6888

commit_message:
Fix failed to start glance when re-stacking

This commit adds stop_glance before start_glance, this will force stop
glance services during re-stacking.

Change-Id: I969e6f8d4ffb74919d32b210c937e3f74d6b8758
Closes-Bug: #1580481

commit_message:
use shared method when create/update object

make lport and lrouter object use update method
to implement create/update function in df_local_controller
which is similar with other resources, this will make the
code more clean and is good for further work for code uniform
and optimization.

Change-Id: I759ea352cad373c076fbc5401d1e55a0f3fb4774
Closes-bug: #1646816

subject: Experimental CNI & VIFBridge binding
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-12-05 18:05:22.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_kubernetes/tests/unit/handlers/test_dispatch.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/clients.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/cni/binding/bridge.py', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'kuryr_kubernetes/cni/__init__.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/cni/binding/base.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/cni/handlers.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/constants.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/cmd/cni.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/cni/main.py', 'requirements.txt', 'kuryr_kubernetes/cni/binding/__init__.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/exceptions.py', 'etc/cni/net.d/10-kuryr.conf', 'kuryr_kubernetes/cni/api.py', 'setup.cfg', 'kuryr_kubernetes/handlers/dispatch.py'], 'message': "Experimental CNI & VIFBridge binding

This patch provides an experimental CNI driver. It's primary purpose
is to enable development of other components (e.g. functional tests,
service/LBaaSv2 support). It is expected to be replaced with daemon
to configure VIF and connect it to the pods and a small lightweight
client to serve as CNI driver called by Kubernetes.

NOTE: unit tests are not provided as part of this patch as it is yet
unclear what parts of it will be reused in daemon-based
implementation.

Change-Id: Iacc8439dd3aee910d542e48ed013d6d3f354786e
Partially-Implements: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration
"}]
commit_message:
Experimental CNI & VIFBridge binding

This patch provides an experimental CNI driver. It's primary purpose
is to enable development of other components (e.g. functional tests,
service/LBaaSv2 support). It is expected to be replaced with daemon
to configure VIF and connect it to the pods and a small lightweight
client to serve as CNI driver called by Kubernetes.

NOTE: unit tests are not provided as part of this patch as it is yet
unclear what parts of it will be reused in daemon-based
implementation.

Change-Id: Iacc8439dd3aee910d542e48ed013d6d3f354786e
Partially-Implements: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration

subject: devstack: add nsenter and fix setup-files race
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 18:03:32.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': "devstack: add nsenter and fix setup-files race

This patch installs 'nsenter' as part of 'hyperkube' installation and
introduces a workaround for a race between 'setup-files.sh' and
'kubernetes-api' service.

Change-Id: Ic7fc7adbc27671b716f5be18529053790b6bd049
"}]
commit_message:
devstack: add nsenter and fix setup-files race

This patch installs 'nsenter' as part of 'hyperkube' installation and
introduces a workaround for a race between 'setup-files.sh' and
'kubernetes-api' service.

commit_message:
Require cellsv2 setup before migrating to Ocata

We have code going into Ocata that needs to be sure that cell and
host mappings are in place. Since this was required homework in
Newton, we can land a migration to intentionally fail if this was
not completed.

This is, however, a little difficult to require because a first-time
deployment will be initialized schema-wise with none of these records,
which is also sane. So, we look to see if any flavors are defined as
a sentinel to indicate that this is an upgrade of an existing
deployment instead of a first-time event. Not perfect, but since this
is really just a helper for the user, it seems like a reasonable
risk.

Depends-On: If1af9c478e8ea2420f2523a9bb8b70fafddc86b7
Change-Id: I72fb724dc13e1a5f4e97c58915b538ba761c582d

subject: Set basic DHCP configuration for neutron.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-03 02:28:01.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/group_vars/neutron_agent.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/dnsmasq-ignore-unknown-clients-5f6b3d36b7ad5e18.yaml'], 'message': 'Set basic DHCP configuration for neutron.

These options simply allow a DHCP server running dnsmasq(neutron) to
coexist with other DHCP servers within the same network. This works
by instructing dnsmasq to ignore any clients which are not specified
in dhcp-host files. This also provides for basic logging which makes
debugging DHCP and connectivity issues easier by default.

Change-Id: Ibe2096c9e5a983fe5a7538a0a58b026439a7c67c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Set basic DHCP configuration for neutron.

These options simply allow a DHCP server running dnsmasq(neutron) to
coexist with other DHCP servers within the same network. This works
by instructing dnsmasq to ignore any clients which are not specified
in dhcp-host files. This also provides for basic logging which makes
debugging DHCP and connectivity issues easier by default.

Change-Id: Ibe2096c9e5a983fe5a7538a0a58b026439a7c67c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/6e1f554da51706211030df28d00626fb\n'

subject: install-distro-packages: Allow to set the profile
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-02 10:25:24.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/install-distro-packages.sh'], 'message': 'install-distro-packages: Allow to set the profile

Currently the profile is hardcoded to test.

In oslo.messaging, we have some packages that are not co-installable.
(qpidd and rabbitmq-server due to a port conflict).

We plan to use tools/test-setup.sh to install only the required one
depending on the tox target that will be run.

In that script we could put all the apt-get/yum commands we need.
But it would be much simpler to use bindep.txt profile and just run:

BINDEP_PROFILE=amqp1 /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

instead of copy/pasting all the package installation commands.

This change adds support of BINDEP_PROFILE envvars to be able to reuse
the install-distro-packages.sh scripts.

Change-Id: I62f4f8cdd8eca0bff217cf63db6500cc410578c2
'}]
commit_message:
install-distro-packages: Allow to set the profile

Currently the profile is hardcoded to test.

In oslo.messaging, we have some packages that are not co-installable.
(qpidd and rabbitmq-server due to a port conflict).

We plan to use tools/test-setup.sh to install only the required one
depending on the tox target that will be run.

In that script we could put all the apt-get/yum commands we need.
But it would be much simpler to use bindep.txt profile and just run:

BINDEP_PROFILE=amqp1 /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

instead of copy/pasting all the package installation commands.

This change adds support of BINDEP_PROFILE envvars to be able to reuse
the install-distro-packages.sh scripts.

Change-Id: I62f4f8cdd8eca0bff217cf63db6500cc410578c2

commit_message:
Add tenant_id to object fetching from db_store

This improves the efficiency by not requiring to compare the tenant id
per object, this is by fetching only the relevant objects from the store
in the first place.

Change-Id: I5a2d1410072e3620ef1717a599637a696e293488

revisions:
[{'number': 19, 'created': '2016-12-07 03:27:52.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/add-HostAddressOpt-6e7e2afe7c7863cb.yaml', 'doc/source/opts.rst', 'oslo_config/sphinxext.py', 'oslo_config/tests/test_types.py', 'oslo_config/cfg.py', 'oslo_config/generator.py', 'oslo_config/types.py'], 'message': 'Fixing HostName and adding support for HostAddress

When config options in different projects use IPOpt as the opt's
type, it restricts operators to only IP addresses.
When the opt is set to HostnameOpt type, currently even an
incomplete or invalid IP passes as a valid hostname. Also, currently
HostnameOpt does not make sure that there is a presense of at least one
non-numeric character in the provided host name.

According to RFC 1123, (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1123),
a valid host name can never have the dotted-decimal form #.#.#.#,
since at least the highest-level component label will be alphabetic.

This patch fixes the existing Hostname Opt to abide by the stated RFC
and also adds a new opt type that would enable operators to provide
either a hostname or an IP and at the same time perform checks on
both IPOpt type and HostnameOpt type, by setting opt type to
"HostAddressOpt" type. This would ensure that an invalid IP does
not pass as a valid hostname and at the same time retains the rules
required to be followed for the validation of an acceptable hostname.

Change-Id: I77bdb64b7e6e56ce761d76696bc4448a9bd325eb
Closes-Bug: #1619044
Closes-Bug: #1615028
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing HostName and adding support for HostAddress

When config options in different projects use IPOpt as the opt's
type, it restricts operators to only IP addresses.
When the opt is set to HostnameOpt type, currently even an
incomplete or invalid IP passes as a valid hostname. Also, currently
HostnameOpt does not make sure that there is a presense of at least one
non-numeric character in the provided host name.

According to RFC 1123, (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1123),
a valid host name can never have the dotted-decimal form #.#.#.#,
since at least the highest-level component label will be alphabetic.

This patch fixes the existing Hostname Opt to abide by the stated RFC
and also adds a new opt type that would enable operators to provide
either a hostname or an IP and at the same time perform checks on
both IPOpt type and HostnameOpt type, by setting opt type to
"HostAddressOpt" type. This would ensure that an invalid IP does
not pass as a valid hostname and at the same time retains the rules
required to be followed for the validation of an acceptable hostname.

Change-Id: I77bdb64b7e6e56ce761d76696bc4448a9bd325eb
Closes-Bug: #1619044
Closes-Bug: #1615028

subject: Finish and cleanup ironic Xenial transition
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-06 23:51:13.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ironic.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': 'Finish and cleanup ironic Xenial transition

Ironic had done some work for their Xenial transition. This finishes it
up and cleans things up. Use -{node} more aggressively in jobs so that
we can reduce the number of regex rules we have in the zuul jobs list.
But also this makes all the jobs consistent making it easier to tell
where things have transitions and where they may not have.

Additionally remove unnecessary branch restrictions because projects
only have a master branch.

Change-Id: I5c327f5307aafa0c5504e9d3a072cb0b17e07580
'}]
commit_message:
Finish and cleanup ironic Xenial transition

Ironic had done some work for their Xenial transition. This finishes it
up and cleans things up. Use -{node} more aggressively in jobs so that
we can reduce the number of regex rules we have in the zuul jobs list.
But also this makes all the jobs consistent making it easier to tell
where things have transitions and where they may not have.

Additionally remove unnecessary branch restrictions because projects
only have a master branch.

Change-Id: I5c327f5307aafa0c5504e9d3a072cb0b17e07580

This affect changes to branches >= newton. Jobs against older branches
continue to run on Trusty.

beacuse this job wasn't passing until recently there is little reason to
run it on trusty and older branches.

If using systemd the -d flag will cause the service to always run

Change-Id: I9d9d98c92b977965b73c10ce37e4b8896723f2bf

'}]
commit_message:
Remove the -d flag to libvirtd when using systemd

If using systemd the -d flag will cause the service to always run
and the service start/stop will not properly manage the daemon.

This should make sure the behavior is not changed when using
upstart.

Change-Id: I9d9d98c92b977965b73c10ce37e4b8896723f2bf
Closes-Bug: 1647637
(cherry picked from commit 41df5aa19d9298ea263a6e3e262ce6aba0f07b20)

subject: Allow X-History-Location versioned_writes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 09:45:18.000000000', 'files': ['templates/proxy-server.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/swift-versioned-writes-middleware-0b529e3cf2fb493d.yaml'], 'message': 'Allow X-History-Location versioned_writes

Versioned Objects in Swift now use a middleware that is added to the
pipeline instead of the "allow_versions" in the container config. These
have 2 different Headers, so to prevent "X-Versions-Location" from not
working the "allow_versions" in the container config is left in place.

This patch adds the middleware by default and sets the Versioned Objects
support to be on. This is the upstream default and the deployer would
still need to set the "X-History-Location" header on a container to
utilise the feature.

Change-Id: I88811fd77fad8d2241448ca5ffb565fa7d704a00
(cherry picked from commit de7ab0a8004a3e8a3c2912d04cb31a100d6d1a9e)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow X-History-Location versioned_writes

Versioned Objects in Swift now use a middleware that is added to the
pipeline instead of the "allow_versions" in the container config. These
have 2 different Headers, so to prevent "X-Versions-Location" from not
working the "allow_versions" in the container config is left in place.

This patch adds the middleware by default and sets the Versioned Objects
support to be on. This is the upstream default and the deployer would
still need to set the "X-History-Location" header on a container to
utilise the feature.

Change-Id: I88811fd77fad8d2241448ca5ffb565fa7d704a00
(cherry picked from commit de7ab0a8004a3e8a3c2912d04cb31a100d6d1a9e)

commit_message:
Domain included for role in list_role_assignment

When calling list_role_assignment and including the "include_names"
parameter, it would return the domain name and ID for each party
except for roles.

This will return the domain name and id for roles when the parameter
is included, if the role has a domain.

Added tests for roles with domains at manager and API level.

Co-Authored-By: Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz <samueldmq@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1607114

Change-Id: I5dae9299522b5116f8530455dd3d3376e9597b52

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-12-02 19:45:26.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/l3_router/service_providers/driver_controller.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': "Eliminate DVR inheritance of router create/update_db

This patch eliminates the following methods in L3 DVR DB
and converts the necessary logic into callbacks:

* _create_router_db
* _update_router_db

There should be no functional difference between the two.
However, this will get us closer to completely eliminating
the inheritance approach for the DVR DB and we can then move
all DVR specific logic into its service provider driver.

This patch had to fix some of the L3HA unit tests that
were instantiating both the regular L3 service plugin as
well as a custom test plugin for L3 operations.

Additionally, to ensure correct ordering of the flag
setting for 'distributed' and the verification of
user-provided flags by the L3 flavor framework, the
L3 flavor framework now subscribed to a BEFORE_CREATE
event that provides the API request before it's mutated
by the DVR code.

Change-Id: I5d4752bf0f8be412af8924d8209bb5fa6d94f40d
"}]
commit_message:
Eliminate DVR inheritance of router create/update_db

This patch eliminates the following methods in L3 DVR DB
and converts the necessary logic into callbacks:

* _create_router_db
* _update_router_db

There should be no functional difference between the two.
However, this will get us closer to completely eliminating
the inheritance approach for the DVR DB and we can then move
all DVR specific logic into its service provider driver.

This patch had to fix some of the L3HA unit tests that
were instantiating both the regular L3 service plugin as
well as a custom test plugin for L3 operations.

Additionally, to ensure correct ordering of the flag
setting for 'distributed' and the verification of
user-provided flags by the L3 flavor framework, the
L3 flavor framework now subscribed to a BEFORE_CREATE
event that provides the API request before it's mutated
by the DVR code.

Change-Id: I5d4752bf0f8be412af8924d8209bb5fa6d94f40d

commit_message:
Get both event drivers into action

This patch hooks both builtin event backends into action.
This patch also fixes the notification objects' initialization logic so
that they are expecting a "real" object instead of a versioned object
struct.

partial-blueprint: generic-event
Change-Id: I5a6075ae85edb6f6f4a04287fb450424ba9955c5

Federated users are no longer ephemeral and are like any other keystone
user. Thus, lets extend the user API to support federated attributes.

commit_message:
Revert "Microversion 2.39 - Simple tenant usage pagination"

This reverts commit f47393dbbfbf36616a8d28348d93e1368763b8c3.

The 2.39 microversion has not been merged in Nova, and this
change is missing a functional test to show the support added
here, which if present would have required a depends-on to the
Nova change for the 2.39 support. So this needs to come back
out until it's ready.

Change-Id: I6b6990b9a4e1e7cfea1d2aabe5f2464614440360

The 'tenant' column in stack and user_creds table in heat DB is
inconsistent with other tables. This change aims to unify it.

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-09 09:21:31.000000000', 'files': ['heat/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': 'Add another choice using heat-manage resource_data_list

When using command heat-manage resource_data_list
usage: heat-manage resource_data_list [-h] resource_id

positional arguments:
  resource_id Stack resource id

The cloud operators need to get the resource id by login to the db
and it is inconvenient. So add another choice to use this command
which specifing resource_name and stack_id augments.

Change-Id: Ib59c0c1ba0b533745b266ba60daf32e67e4e01fd
Closes-Bug: #1570704
'}]
commit_message:
Add another choice using heat-manage resource_data_list

When using command heat-manage resource_data_list
usage: heat-manage resource_data_list [-h] resource_id

positional arguments:
  resource_id Stack resource id

The cloud operators need to get the resource id by login to the db
and it is inconvenient. So add another choice to use this command
which specifing resource_name and stack_id augments.

Change-Id: Ib59c0c1ba0b533745b266ba60daf32e67e4e01fd
Closes-Bug: #1570704

subject: Tag the alembic migration revisions for Newton
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-07 23:31:25.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_taas/db/migration/alembic_migration/versions/newton/expand/fddbdec8711a_add_status.py', 'neutron_taas/db/migration/alembic_migration/versions/newton/contract/4086b3cffc01_rename_tenant_to_project.py'], 'message': 'Tag the alembic migration revisions for Newton

Tag the alembic migration revisions for Newton

This allows the database to be upgraded with the command:
  neutron-db-manage upgrade newton

commit_message:
[k8s_fedora_atomic] Remove podmaster

Podmaster is deprecated since k8s 1.2 and its docker
image is v1, incompatible with docker >=1.12.

* Remove podmaster pod
* Update manifests of kube-controller-manager and kube-scheduler
* Rename SoftwareConfig to reflect the new functionality

Closes-Bug: #1646109
Change-Id: Ibf4ce06cbf5b79a4241c58c67b13a7c68145d3ae

The patch introduces the same functionality as the command line

commit_message:
Allow keypair in cluster creation

The patch introduces the same functionality as the command line
interface.  When the template contains keypair, user can either provide
a new keypair for the cluster or inherit one from the template. When
template has no keypair attached, user has to provide a keypair for the
cluster, otherwise the error will be returned (exactly as for the CLI).

Closes-Bug: #1645754
Change-Id: I07c43be68022492f3c59b391ce6c31efc7b0aa79

subject: ISA-L Cauchy support
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-12-07 01:09:07.000000000', 'files': ['src/Makefile.am', 'test/liberasurecode_test.c', 'include/isa_l/isa_l_common.h', 'src/erasurecode.c', 'include/erasurecode/erasurecode.h', 'src/backends/isa-l/isa_l_rs_vand.c', 'src/backends/isa-l/isa_l_rs_cauchy.c', 'src/backends/isa-l/isa_l_common.c'], 'message': 'ISA-L Cauchy support

This is for supporting ISA-L cauchy based matrix. The difference
from isa_l_rs_vand is only the matrix to use the encode/decode calculation.

As a known issue, isa_l_rs_vand backend has constraint for the
combinations of the available fragment to be able to decode/reconstuct.
(See related change in detail)

To avoid the constraint, this patch adds another isa-l backend to use
cauchy matrix and keep the backward compatibility, this is in
another isa_l_rs_cauchy namespace.

For implementation consieration, the code is almost same except the matrix
generation fucntion so that this patch makes isa_l_common.c file for
gathering common fucntions like init/encode/decode/reconstruct. And then the
common init funciton takes an extra args "gen_matrix_func_name" for entry
point to load the fucntion by dlsym from isa-l .so file.

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>

Related-Change: Icee788a0931fe692fe0de31fabc4ba450e338a87
Change-Id: I6eb150d9d0c3febf233570fa7729f9f72df2e9be
'}]
commit_message:
ISA-L Cauchy support

This is for supporting ISA-L cauchy based matrix. The difference
from isa_l_rs_vand is only the matrix to use the encode/decode calculation.

As a known issue, isa_l_rs_vand backend has constraint for the
combinations of the available fragment to be able to decode/reconstuct.
(See related change in detail)

To avoid the constraint, this patch adds another isa-l backend to use
cauchy matrix and keep the backward compatibility, this is in
another isa_l_rs_cauchy namespace.

For implementation consieration, the code is almost same except the matrix
generation fucntion so that this patch makes isa_l_common.c file for
gathering common fucntions like init/encode/decode/reconstruct. And then the
common init funciton takes an extra args "gen_matrix_func_name" for entry
point to load the fucntion by dlsym from isa-l .so file.

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>

Related-Change: Icee788a0931fe692fe0de31fabc4ba450e338a87
Change-Id: I6eb150d9d0c3febf233570fa7729f9f72df2e9be

subject: Bump cryptography to work with patched openssl
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-01 15:28:40.000000000', 'files': ['upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Bump cryptography to work with patched openssl

cryptography embeds some data structures and function signatures from
openssl in its source code. One of these changed in a recent openssl
security release. The result of this is that it is not possible to
build python-cryptography<1.2.3 against the latest security patch of
openssl. We're pinning it to 1.1.2 for liberty, which is affected.

The issue is described here:
https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/2750

There are no 1.1.X releases after 1.1.2. I have confirmed that 1.2.3
is buildable, but 1.2.2 is not, so 1.2.3 is the minimum supportable
version.

The cffi bump to 1.5.2 is a dependency, as cryptography 1.2.3 requires
def_extern from cffi, which was not available in 1.3.1.

Change-Id: Iec0cf800f612213089e4997780473c5b6f9ae1d7
"}]
commit_message:
Bump cryptography to work with patched openssl

cryptography embeds some data structures and function signatures from
openssl in its source code. One of these changed in a recent openssl
security release. The result of this is that it is not possible to
build python-cryptography<1.2.3 against the latest security patch of
openssl. We're pinning it to 1.1.2 for liberty, which is affected.

The issue is described here:
https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/2750

There are no 1.1.X releases after 1.1.2. I have confirmed that 1.2.3
is buildable, but 1.2.2 is not, so 1.2.3 is the minimum supportable
version.

The cffi bump to 1.5.2 is a dependency, as cryptography 1.2.3 requires
def_extern from cffi, which was not available in 1.3.1.

Change-Id: Iec0cf800f612213089e4997780473c5b6f9ae1d7

commit_message:
Support query resources with non-ascii code

Now client doesn't support to query resources with non-ascii code,
the error 'UnicodeEncodeError' raised here.
This patch convert the code to utf-8.

Change-Id: Ifb42888e46821163ee79e764a2684deee05e1feb
Closes-bug: #1647569

commit_message:
Add converter to convert IPv6 addresses to canonical format

With respect to Section-4 of [1], the following patch adds
a function to compress the extended IPv6 address passed to
the neutron server to its canonical form. This allows
compressed IPv6 addresses to be stored and remove any
leading zeroes in the IPv6 addresses.

Non-canonical IPv6 address formatted inputs wont be blocked,
but the addresses would be normalized to canonical formats.

[1]: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5952

Partial-Bug: #1531103
Change-Id: Ic9afa5f90fba783748f7c56e8fba02e06af69748

commit_message:
"neutron help agent-update" help info updated

Initially we were unable to see complete help
info for "neutron agent-update" command.
Now, with this patch complete help info is
displayed to the user. Apart from the existing
information, the following information will
also be displayed:-
    --admin-state-up

Change-Id: Id7e7889742ca37cf1a9c0d55fba78d967e90e8d0

commit_message:
Avoid infinite loop while placing parts

Previously, we could over-assign how many parts should be in a tier.
This would cause the local `parts` variable to go negative, which meant
that our `while parts` loop would never terminate.

Change-Id: Id7e7889742ca37cf1a9c0d55fba78d967e90e8d0
Closes-Bug: 1642538
(cherry picked from commit 2e7a7347fc58676fbaabce3d87a15866796d32e4)

subject: Fixed regression in consolidate_hashes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-25 12:41:53.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'message': 'Fixed regression in consolidate_hashes

Occurs when a new file is stored to new suffix to not empty partition.
Then suffix is added to an invalidations file but not into hashes
pickle file. When a replication of this partition runs, replication of
suffix is completed on first and each 10th run of replicator. Rsync
runs on each new suffix because destination does not return hash of
new suffix although suffix content is in the same state.
This bug was introduced in 2.7.0

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Change-Id: Ie2700f6e6171f2ecfa7d07b0f18b79e90cbf1c8a
Closes-Bug: #1634967
(cherry picked from commit 8ac432fff3e01a07f4bff918bb9cc38d93532b43)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed regression in consolidate_hashes

Occurs when a new file is stored to new suffix to not empty partition.
Then suffix is added to an invalidations file but not into hashes
pickle file. When a replication of this partition runs, replication of
suffix is completed on first and each 10th run of replicator. Rsync
runs on each new suffix because destination does not return hash of
new suffix although suffix content is in the same state.
This bug was introduced in 2.7.0

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Change-Id: Ie2700f6e6171f2ecfa7d07b0f18b79e90cbf1c8a
Closes-Bug: #1634967
(cherry picked from commit 8ac432fff3e01a07f4bff918bb9cc38d93532b43)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-25 12:41:35.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'message': 'Fixed regression in consolidate_hashes

Occurs when a new file is stored to new suffix to not empty partition.
Then suffix is added to an invalidations file but not into hashes
pickle file. When a replication of this partition runs, replication of
suffix is completed on first and each 10th run of replicator. Rsync
runs on each new suffix because destination does not return hash of
new suffix although suffix content is in the same state.
This bug was introduced in 2.7.0

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Change-Id: Ie2700f6e6171f2ecfa7d07b0f18b79e90cbf1c8a
Closes-Bug: #1634967

commit_message:
Fixed regression in consolidate_hashes

Occurs when a new file is stored to new suffix to not empty partition.
Then suffix is added to an invalidations file but not into hashes
pickle file. When a replication of this partition runs, replication of
suffix is completed on first and each 10th run of replicator. Rsync
runs on each new suffix because destination does not return hash of
new suffix although suffix content is in the same state.
This bug was introduced in 2.7.0

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Change-Id: Ie2700f6e6171f2ecfa7d07b0f18b79e90cbf1c8a
Closes-Bug: #1634967
(cherry picked from commit 8ac432fff3e01a07f4bff918bb9cc38d93532b43)

subject: Fix non-deterministic suffix updates in hashes.pkl
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-02 12:43:30.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/replicator.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'message': 'Fix non-deterministic suffix updates in hashes.pkl

Right now the do_listdir option was set on every 10th replication run.
Due to the randomness of the job listing this might update a given
partition much less often than expected, for example with 1000
partitions per replicator only every ~70th run.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Christian Schwede <cschwede@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1634967
Closes-Bug: 1644807
Change-Id: Ib5c9dd17e40150450ec57a728ae8652fbc730af6
'}]
commit_message:
Fix non-deterministic suffix updates in hashes.pkl

Right now the do_listdir option was set on every 10th replication run.
Due to the randomness of the job listing this might update a given
partition much less often than expected, for example with 1000
partitions per replicator only every ~70th run.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Christian Schwede <cschwede@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1634967
Closes-Bug: 1644807
Change-Id: Ib5c9dd17e40150450ec57a728ae8652fbc730af6

commit_message:
Fix non-deterministic suffix updates in hashes.pkl

Right now the do_listdir option was set on every 10th replication run.
Due to the randomness of the job listing this might update a given
partition much less often than expected, for example with 1000
partitions per replicator only every ~70th run.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Christian Schwede <cschwede@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1634967
Closes-Bug: 1644807
Change-Id: Ib5c9dd17e40150450ec57a728ae8652fbc730af6

commit_message:

commit_message:
Update upper constraint for pylxd

nova-lxd requires 2.2+ in order to update some its functionality.
However, a bug in requests caused some issues with 2.2.0 and
2.2.1. This updates global requirements to 2.2.2.

is included to remind deployers to avoid placing bootloaders on removable
media.

subject: [Docs] Exception: logging level
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-06 17:12:01.000000000', 'files': ['doc/metadata/rhel7/RHEL-07-040020.rst'], 'message': "[Docs] Exception: logging level

This patch adds docs to explain that CentOS/RHEL/Ubuntu already log
in a way that meets the STIG's requirements. Deployers should not need
to adjust these configurations unless their environment requires it.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Ibac4a1de917a67cb21494466bcabb746d3aaf540
"}]
commit_message:
[Docs] Exception: logging level

This patch adds docs to explain that CentOS/RHEL/Ubuntu already log
in a way that meets the STIG's requirements. Deployers should not need
to adjust these configurations unless their environment requires it.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig

of this patch. It also add object db api for one_or_none()

commit_message:
Add query.one to object.db.api

There are some queries in neutron code base which are using
sqlalchemy's one method, I added this previously in patch [1].
for faster landing separating from [1] and will rebase [1] on top
of this patch. It also add object db api for one_or_none()

[1]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/381333/

Change-Id: I1968c3c8e832db22d9fddf46955eb0879cf9897c
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

subject: Bump hacking upper to 0.13.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-01 19:25:52.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Bump hacking upper to 0.13.0

Hacking 0.13.0 was recently released [1][2] and contains
a backwards compatible (new) feature [3] we'd like to leverage.
As the bump from hacking 0.12.0 to 0.13.0 is only this optional
new feature (no new hacking checks), projects don't need to
move up to 0.13.0 so only the upper constraint is bumped for
those who do.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/403927/
[2] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/hacking/0.13.0
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/397940/

Change-Id: Ic0eaa87a427ec525cfb75121d8b6e140d115a658
"}]
commit_message:
Bump hacking upper to 0.13.0

Hacking 0.13.0 was recently released [1][2] and contains
a backwards compatible (new) feature [3] we'd like to leverage.
As the bump from hacking 0.12.0 to 0.13.0 is only this optional
new feature (no new hacking checks), projects don't need to
move up to 0.13.0 so only the upper constraint is bumped for
those who do.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/403927/
[2] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/hacking/0.13.0
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/397940/

Change-Id: Ic0eaa87a427ec525cfb75121d8b6e140d115a658

commit_message:
Convert Designate jobs to Xenial

This is part of the Trusty to Xenial transition. For changes against
branches >= newton run on Xenial. Older branches continue to run on
Trusty.

Note that this updates jobs to use use the pdns4 driver on Xenial as the
powerdns driver is for older versions of powerdns.

Also this updates the designate grenade jobs which have the following
layout:

  Trusty:
    mitaka -> newton
  Xenial
    newton -> master/ocata

Change-Id: I1fc6c629364336418733fcf2564c2c28b5589dcb

commit_message:
Define when an action plan is stale/invalid

When an audit is created and launched successfully, it generates
a new Action Plan with status RECOMMENDED. If the Cluster Data
Model has changed by and by, the action plan is still keep the
RECOMMENDED state. There is not an expiry date or event that can
invalidate the action plan by far.
It should be possible to add a new "SUPERSEDED" state for Action
Plan and Action.

Change-Id: I875fbcb44876114b69fc1eaf4729aa7b292b399c
Implements: blueprint stale-action-plan

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-05 15:22:25.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/install-ansible-source.sh', 'scripts/install-ansible-pip.sh', 'scripts/install-deps.sh', 'scripts/env-setup.sh'], 'message': 'Allow installing Ansible from PyPI

As of Ansible v2.2 all the missing modules bifrost requires are included
in the pip-installable Ansible package.
Let's allow then for a possiibility for bifrost to install Ansible
directly from PyPI (into the system or in virtualenv) instead
of from cloned source repo.

This patsh first extracts the installation of binary/Python dependencies
and installation of Ansible itself from the "env-setup.sh" script to two
separate scripts "install-deps.sh" and "install-ansible-source.sh".

It also adds a third script "install-ansible-pip.sh" that is called when
environment variable ANSIBLE_FROM_PYPI is set to "True"
(default is "False" for backward compatibility).
It then looks up ANSIBLE_PIP_VERSION env variable (defaults to "2.2")
and pip-installs Ansible of that given version strictly.

Change-Id: Ia72e06d7bf127569d423fa521b8ddab87453809e
'}]
commit_message:
Allow installing Ansible from PyPI

As of Ansible v2.2 all the missing modules bifrost requires are included
in the pip-installable Ansible package.
Let's allow then for a possiibility for bifrost to install Ansible
directly from PyPI (into the system or in virtualenv) instead
of from cloned source repo.

This patsh first extracts the installation of binary/Python dependencies
and installation of Ansible itself from the "env-setup.sh" script to two
separate scripts "install-deps.sh" and "install-ansible-source.sh".

It also adds a third script "install-ansible-pip.sh" that is called when
environment variable ANSIBLE_FROM_PYPI is set to "True"
(default is "False" for backward compatibility).
It then looks up ANSIBLE_PIP_VERSION env variable (defaults to "2.2")
and pip-installs Ansible of that given version strictly.

Change-Id: Ia72e06d7bf127569d423fa521b8ddab87453809e

subject: No longer hard coding to a specifc network interface name.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-04 22:07:08.000000000', 'files': ['firstboot/os-net-config-mappings.yaml'], 'message': 'No longer hard coding to a specifc network interface name.

Instead of using a specific network interface name, thi fix
fetch all ethernet mac addresses. Then uses this list of
mac addresses to do a check if any entries in the list
match any of the values in NetConfigDataLookup for a node.
If there is a match, the /etc/os-net-config/mapping.yaml
file for the node will be written.

This fix removes the hard coded interface name 'eth0' used
to get a mac address as identifyer for the specific node
before. Using a hard coded interface name such as 'eth0'
would have failed on most hardware because of "consistent
network device names".

    Fix Bug: #1642551

Change-Id: I6c1d1b4d70b916bc5d9049469df8221f8ab2eb95
(cherry picked from commit 06d4d088adcceb6076017fb2a58b5a339232a6a3)
'}]
commit_message:
No longer hard coding to a specifc network interface name.

Instead of using a specific network interface name, thi fix
fetch all ethernet mac addresses. Then uses this list of
mac addresses to do a check if any entries in the list
match any of the values in NetConfigDataLookup for a node.
If there is a match, the /etc/os-net-config/mapping.yaml
file for the node will be written.

This fix removes the hard coded interface name 'eth0' used
to get a mac address as identifyer for the specific node
before. Using a hard coded interface name such as 'eth0'
would have failed on most hardware because of "consistent
network device names".

    Fix Bug: #1642551

Change-Id: I6c1d1b4d70b916bc5d9049469df8221f8ab2eb95
(cherry picked from commit 06d4d088adcceb6076017fb2a58b5a339232a6a3)

For jobs that are running a grenade plugin (for example the Ironic
grenade job), the environment variable GRENADE_PLUGINRC is used.
Therefore if that variable exists it needs to be part of reproduce.sh.

If TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY has been explicitly set to 1, as is the case

'}]
commit_message:
Add GRENADE_PLUGINRC and TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY to reproduce.sh

For jobs that are running a grenade plugin (for example the Ironic
grenade job), the environment variable GRENADE_PLUGINRC is used.
Therefore if that variable exists it needs to be part of reproduce.sh.

If TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY has been explicitly set to 1, as is the case
for Ironic grenade jobs, then also write it to reproduce.sh.

Change-Id: Ib038053633e8b43430c8116daa27b1d6f5bce913

commit_message:
Fix python-virtualenv references for puppet4

In order for this module to be used with puppet-python on puppet4, we
need to reference the virtualenv package by title ("virtualenv") instead
of by name ("python-virtualenv").

Change-Id: I24d40a499a805d8cdc1024e533ba8500115e4ea2

commit_message:
Python 3 Compatible JSON

In order to be really python3 compatible, the json lib was replaced
with oslo.serialization(1.10 or newer) module jsontuils since it's
the recommended migration to python3 guide.

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3#Serialization:_base64.2C_JSON.2C_etc.

Change-Id: I2d8b62e642aba4ccd1b70be7e9b3784a95a6743d
Closes-Bug: #1629068
(cherry picked from commit ab41106cf66f779f4b29a113ab1757bc7de66f0c)

Change-Id: I75936ac26eacb19236adcadd6481ee235e5812a7

commit_message:
Allow run-os-net-config to be idempotent

When upgrading the OVS containers this script can get rerun causing
the network configurations in the container to be rewritten by the
host config.  This change ensures this script can be rerun without
issues.

Change-Id: I75936ac26eacb19236adcadd6481ee235e5812a7

commit_message:
pci: nova fail to boot when wrong setting in pci_whitelist

when I wrong config nova.conf with a space in the head of
product_id in pci_whitelist, it would cause the nova-compute
service boot failed. it shows:

Trace:
 get_pci_dev_info(self, 'product_id', MAX_PRODUCT_ID, '%04x')
 File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/pci/devspec.py", line 37, in \
   get_pci_dev_info
   v = get_value(a)
 File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/pci/devspec.py", line 30, in \
   get_value
   return ast.literal_eval("0x" + v)
 File "/usr/lib/python2.7/ast.py", line 49, in literal_eval
   node_or_string = parse(node_or_string, mode='eval')
 File "/usr/lib/python2.7/ast.py", line 37, in parse
   return compile(source, filename, mode, PyCF_ONLY_AST)
 File "<unknown>", line 1
   0x 1347
    ^
SyntaxError: invalid token

this patch fix it.

Closes-bug: #1620434
Change-Id: I1978139b4d2f85bd3018d5d64c73eb2206af3223

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-07 09:26:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/storage_users.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'imagecache: Hold shared storage registry lock while running

This addresses 3 races in image cache:

1. Absent any locking, if the clean job took a very long time to run,
   it was possible for multiple instances of the job to run
   concurrently on the same host. As the job uses global state, this
   will certainly break.

2. When using shared storage, it was possible for a compute host to be
   brought up and create an instance which uses an existing backing
   image before the image cache manager runs for the first time. As
   we only run register_storage_use when the image cache manager runs,
   this means another host running the image cache manager on the same
   storage will not be aware of our instance when choosing which
   images to reap.

3. When using shared storage, it was possible for the image cache
   manager to run concurrently on different hosts. This is complex to
   reason about, and almost certainly fraught with bugs.

(2) and (3) are likely both mitigated if not practically resolved by
change I376cc951. However, a clean lock makes this code much simpler
to reason about.

This does not make this code race free, because we still race with
instance create. Change I376cc951 significantly reduces, but does not
eliminate that race window.

Resolves-bug: #1620341
Change-Id: I19d38f076bb1323c157a0bef4bf55ed5b1cf408a
'}]
commit_message:
imagecache: Hold shared storage registry lock while running

This addresses 3 races in image cache:

1. Absent any locking, if the clean job took a very long time to run,
   it was possible for multiple instances of the job to run
   concurrently on the same host. As the job uses global state, this
   will certainly break.

2. When using shared storage, it was possible for a compute host to be
   brought up and create an instance which uses an existing backing
   image before the image cache manager runs for the first time. As
   we only run register_storage_use when the image cache manager runs,
   this means another host running the image cache manager on the same
   storage will not be aware of our instance when choosing which
   images to reap.

3. When using shared storage, it was possible for the image cache
   manager to run concurrently on different hosts. This is complex to
   reason about, and almost certainly fraught with bugs.

(2) and (3) are likely both mitigated if not practically resolved by
change I376cc951. However, a clean lock makes this code much simpler
to reason about.

This does not make this code race free, because we still race with
instance create. Change I376cc951 significantly reduces, but does not
eliminate that race window.

Resolves-bug: #1620341
Change-Id: I19d38f076bb1323c157a0bef4bf55ed5b1cf408a

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-13 02:53:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/pci/manager.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/pci/stats.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py', 'nova/pci/whitelist.py'], 'message': '[sr-iov] pci passthrough whitelist doesn't support multi node

pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address": "0000:0a:00.1",
                             "physical_network": "physnet1"}
If a nova-compute supports multi nodes. The nodes's pci address maybe repeat.
So format above can not describe the situation.
pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address": "0000:0a:00.1",
                             "node": "xxxx",
                             "physical_network": "physnet1"}
The above fomat will work
Closes-Bug: #1612029

Change-Id: I343ed47086e06b40dd3497000748fac374f85aee
'}]
commit_message:
[sr-iov] pci passthrough whitelist doesn't support multi node

pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address": "0000:0a:00.1",
                             "physical_network": "physnet1"}
If a nova-compute supports multi nodes. The nodes's pci address maybe repeat.
So format above can not describe the situation.
pci_passthrough_whitelist = {"address": "0000:0a:00.1",
                             "node": "xxxx",
                             "physical_network": "physnet1"}
The above fomat will work
Closes-Bug: #1612029

Change-Id: I343ed47086e06b40dd3497000748fac374f85aee

commit_message:
Add option to disable local disks in flavors [2/3]

This new feature adds the possibility to define a flavor,
that does not create ephemeral disks on the hypervisor;
A new boolean field 'local_disks' is added to flavors.
If local_disks=False, users are "forced" to create
a bootable volume to launch an instance from that flavor.

This commit is the compute/api.py related part of the
implementation.

Change-Id: I782eb2e8d9bed4818d5d76446eca1da500a7eb8f
Implements: blueprint flavor-root-disk-none
