[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-06 05:39:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'devstack/tempest-dsvm-lvm-rc', 'nova/virt/libvirt/storage/lvm.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Enable instance resizing for LVM backed instances

These changes enable the resize operation surrounding LVM backed
instances. If the resize operation is scheduled for the same compute,
then the lvresize command is used to resize the disk. If the resize
operation is scheduled for another compute (cold migration), then the
instance is rebuilt on the new compute with the new size and no local
lvm disk resizing will occur.

Add LVM support functions needed to support resizing LVM backed
instances. This adds rename_volume(), create_duplicate_volume(),
resize_volume(), and get_volume_vg().

Add detection and removal of all LVM disks associated with the instance
that end with "_resize". These LVM disks are the original instance disks
that are preserved prior to attempting the resize/migration operation
performed on the instance. As this operation has been completed, they
must be removed.

Change-Id: I342220c88a2413f610d6bd072391c35ce216e012
'}]
commit_message:
Enable instance resizing for LVM backed instances

These changes enable the resize operation surrounding LVM backed
instances. If the resize operation is scheduled for the same compute,
then the lvresize command is used to resize the disk. If the resize
operation is scheduled for another compute (cold migration), then the
instance is rebuilt on the new compute with the new size and no local
lvm disk resizing will occur.

Add LVM support functions needed to support resizing LVM backed
instances. This adds rename_volume(), create_duplicate_volume(),
resize_volume(), and get_volume_vg().

Add detection and removal of all LVM disks associated with the instance
that end with "_resize". These LVM disks are the original instance disks
that are preserved prior to attempting the resize/migration operation
performed on the instance. As this operation has been completed, they
must be removed.

Change-Id: I342220c88a2413f610d6bd072391c35ce216e012

This is a workaround to libvirt issue described here:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1372944. The problem is that
libvirt dosn't update the mac address of the netdevice, instead it uses
netlink to configure the mac address of the VF. For macvtap to work
libvirt should set the mac address on the VF net device and using
netlink. Until this is fixed we should set both of them in nova.

Closes-Bug: #1622292

Change-Id: Ib4919c2db48ae7256d7e22b1abbd6525ea0929df
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Assign mac address to vf netdevice when using macvtap port

This is a workaround to libvirt issue described here:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1372944. The problem is that
libvirt dosn't update the mac address of the netdevice, instead it uses
netlink to configure the mac address of the VF. For macvtap to work
libvirt should set the mac address on the VF net device and using
netlink. Until this is fixed we should set both of them in nova.

Closes-Bug: #1622292

Change-Id: Ib4919c2db48ae7256d7e22b1abbd6525ea0929df

commit_message:
filters: remove the local full/part msg variable

the local full/part msg variable just used to format
the output log, we exactly don't need them.

Since the LOG.output translates the message is delayed to be
handled by logging code, so the message got from mock_log.
call_args is not translated. we should force translating it
beforce assertIn.

Change-Id: Id34eeaf23d39f30351660a3de58c5efa03626f4f

commit_message:
Add API for delete allocations by RP_UUID and CONSUMER_ID

For support move_claim with placement API, it needs an API to drop the
claim on the source or destination host.

The current API 'DELETE /allocations/{consumer_id}' will remove all the
allocations for the specific instance. It leads to the resource consuming
will be drop both on the source and destination host.

This patch adds new API:
'DELETE /resource_providers/{rp_uuid}/allocations/{consumer_id}'

This API support to drop allocation on specific ResourceProvider. It will
be used to implement the move_claim drop.

Change-Id: Iacb1ea2017b1f9069802e30efb5b48d35e00488a
Partial-Bug: #1621709

commit_message:
Retain ucast_macs_remote if l2gw connection exists

In a scenario, where network is a part of multiple
l2-gateway-connections, retain ucast_macs_remote entries
in ovsdb until the last l2-gateway-connection is deleted
for that network.

Closes-Bug: 1607399

(cherry picked from commit cdded15b4dea474d65730f81245590e734b9594c)


Change-Id: I6d63c5ff0c3c9d208612eeec25351977a40820c0

subject: Do not re-set the members cache for watchers by default
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-11-30 13:58:09.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/tests/test_coordination.py', 'tooz/drivers/file.py', 'tooz/drivers/zookeeper.py', 'tooz/drivers/memcached.py', 'tooz/coordination.py', 'tooz/drivers/redis.py'], 'message': 'Do not re-set the members cache for watchers by default

The current code fills the group membership cache by default – without
any check for data already been there - which can lead to a race
condition in the following situation:

 coord1.watch_group_join(x, cb1) # Cache is filled: contains {}
 coord2.join_group(x)
 coord1.watch_group_join(x, cb2) # Cache is re-filled: contains {coord2}
 coord1.run_watchers() # Calls nothing since no new join is seen whereas
                       # it should call cb1

Change-Id: I7376c9f320a37bb44282b52fa5b6fa3f1f86784b
'}]
commit_message:
Do not re-set the members cache for watchers by default

The current code fills the group membership cache by default – without
any check for data already been there - which can lead to a race
condition in the following situation:

 coord1.watch_group_join(x, cb1) # Cache is filled: contains {}
 coord2.join_group(x)
 coord1.watch_group_join(x, cb2) # Cache is re-filled: contains {coord2}
 coord1.run_watchers() # Calls nothing since no new join is seen whereas
                       # it should call cb1

Change-Id: I7376c9f320a37bb44282b52fa5b6fa3f1f86784b

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-11-30 13:58:09.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/tests/test_coordination.py'], 'message': 'coordination: renforce event based testing

The current test plan only check for the last event being created. In
the case an implementation is broken and emits more than 1 event when

This patch makes sure nothing is broken.

Change-Id: I14575a6ba86798d925e345c4a4c5190223ab8ec9
'}]
commit_message:
coordination: renforce event based testing

The current test plan only check for the last event being created. In
the case an implementation is broken and emits more than 1 event when
running watchers, the tests would not see the difference.

This patch makes sure nothing is broken.

Change-Id: I14575a6ba86798d925e345c4a4c5190223ab8ec9

revisions:

Any coordinator that implements (and they all should) group membership
needs a member_id field and copy it to self. Just do that by default for
all driver at __init__ time.

Change-Id: I66d82815afd4c6e9354212e5ab3fba17931c1bbc
'}]
commit_message:
Factorize member_id in the base coordinator class

Any coordinator that implements (and they all should) group membership
needs a member_id field and copy it to self. Just do that by default for
all driver at __init__ time.

Change-Id: I66d82815afd4c6e9354212e5ab3fba17931c1bbc

subject: Use the internal group of list rather than listing the groups
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-11-30 13:58:09.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/coordination.py'], 'message': 'Use the internal group of list rather than listing the groups

For an unknown reason, the common run_watchers implementation prefers to
list the group using the driver rather than using the groups that
actually have hooks. This simplify the code and save us from a
round-trip of getting the list of group.

Change-Id: Ice06b8282a8c48fc4963b451a8a3e03b6684e90f
'}]
commit_message:
Use the internal group of list rather than listing the groups

For an unknown reason, the common run_watchers implementation prefers to
list the group using the driver rather than using the groups that
actually have hooks. This simplify the code and save us from a
round-trip of getting the list of group.

Change-Id: Ice06b8282a8c48fc4963b451a8a3e03b6684e90f

There's a lot of methods implementing the common watcher tools that are
inherited from all drivers whereas there is no need for that. The mixin
is actually not correctly designed, as it mixes the hooks and the cache

This splits out the common implementation into its common class that can
be inherited to implement this model of driver.

"}]
commit_message:
Move the cached-based watcher implementation into its own class

There's a lot of methods implementing the common watcher tools that are
inherited from all drivers whereas there is no need for that. The mixin
is actually not correctly designed, as it mixes the hooks and the cache
code.

This splits out the common implementation into its common class that can
be inherited to implement this model of driver.

The Kazoo and Zake drivers are also merged to simplify code, as the base
class was not used.

Change-Id: I1acbf1983165d00e68b96cbca2bc5c1e2acadfa8

commit_message:
Add a check to make sure the right assert* method is used

It is recommended to use
assert{Greater,GreaterEqual,Less,LessEqual,Equal,NotEqual} rather than
assertTrue(comparison).

Change-Id: Idd57a5e7897b839707371033d7f25604d44e9cd9

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-28 01:52:37.000000000', 'files': ['osprofiler/profiler.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable. 2.In py2, the performance about list
should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: If93f87da6853b4e1bb29bd421520f1e74897c6eb
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable. 2.In py2, the performance about list
should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: If93f87da6853b4e1bb29bd421520f1e74897c6eb

subject: Error out for invalid trace ID
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-02 10:26:12.000000000', 'files': ['osprofiler/tests/cmd/test_shell.py', 'osprofiler/cmd/commands.py'], 'message': "Error out for invalid trace ID

There is no error message printed if the trace ID input to the
'trace show' command is invalid. Fixing this by checking for
empty child nodes at the root of the trace result from driver.

Change-Id: I8fc40356cffa98f5e9b9f6048b8fe422271f41f0
Closes-bug: #1644448
"}]
commit_message:
Error out for invalid trace ID

There is no error message printed if the trace ID input to the
'trace show' command is invalid. Fixing this by checking for
empty child nodes at the root of the trace result from driver.

Change-Id: I8fc40356cffa98f5e9b9f6048b8fe422271f41f0
Closes-bug: #1644448

This patch adds the following two RPCs in order to support
volume target operations in Ironic.

- update_volume_target()

  target that is stored in the database.

- destroy_volume_target()
  This function is called to remove a volume target from the database.

Co-Authored-By: Stephane Miller <stephane@alum.mit.edu>

commit_message:
Add RPCs to support volume target operations

This patch adds the following two RPCs in order to support
volume target operations in Ironic.

- update_volume_target()
  This function is called to update the information about a volume
  target that is stored in the database.

- destroy_volume_target()
  This function is called to remove a volume target from the database.

Co-Authored-By: Stephane Miller <stephane@alum.mit.edu>
Co-Authored-By: Ruby Loo <ruby.loo@intel.com>

subject: Remove test of having a thundering herd
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-05 20:31:19.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_caching.py'], 'message': "Remove test of having a thundering herd

The important test is the following one, which tests that we prevent
thundering herds. The test that we _have_ one is subject to a race
condition where the mocks execute so quickly that we don't herd even
without the protection. But that's ok - it's ok for a herd to
accidentally not happen. So remove the test which is just false-negative
noise.

Change-Id: I10c418a2c4ba2d8d1b0b3a22516bff2a688555a7
"}]
commit_message:
Remove test of having a thundering herd

The important test is the following one, which tests that we prevent
thundering herds. The test that we _have_ one is subject to a race
condition where the mocks execute so quickly that we don't herd even
without the protection. But that's ok - it's ok for a herd to
accidentally not happen. So remove the test which is just false-negative
noise.

Change-Id: I10c418a2c4ba2d8d1b0b3a22516bff2a688555a7

revisions:

Change-Id: I68984e72cfb2073a6b3bbe98cd935632c3be138f
"}]
commit_message:
[Docs] Exception for removing unnecessary accounts

It isn't possible for automated tasks to determine which accounts are
unnecessary. Deployers must perform these audits manually.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I68984e72cfb2073a6b3bbe98cd935632c3be138f

Closes-Bug: 1647481

commit_message:
Gather facts before running first role requiring them

The pip_install role is using variables requiring facts to be
present. The best way to fix this issue is to gather_facts
in the bootstrap-aio playbook.

Change-Id: Idfbcf54faa90013d229b415463ce664dbda7f334
Closes-Bug: 1647481

Change-Id: Iea82aa6f2fc81b40d5488a56ee7382b3ef6a2eab

commit_message:
[Docs] Exception for cron logging

All distributions supported by the role already collect cron logs. The
role won't change the syslog configuration from the default.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Iea82aa6f2fc81b40d5488a56ee7382b3ef6a2eab

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

Change-Id: If27279ec325cefdf713dc924617429afc0834c87
"}]
commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/2b00c35799734733ecdec861c74975d8\n'

Change-Id: If27279ec325cefdf713dc924617429afc0834c87

subject: Add network templates for multiple NICs with flat and VLAN tagged networks
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 11505, 'name': 'John Browning', 'email': 'johnb@redhat.com', 'username': 'johbro'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}, {'_account_id': 13705, 'name': 'Felipe Alfaro Solana', 'email': 'felipe.alfaro@gmail.com', 'username': 'falfaro'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-19 03:28:00.000000000', 'files': ['network/config/three-nics-vlans/compute.yaml', 'network/config/three-nics-vlans/cinder-storage.yaml', 'network/config/three-nics-vlans/swift-storage.yaml', 'network/config/three-nics-vlans/README.md', 'environments/net-three-nics-vlans.yaml', 'network/config/three-nics-vlans/ceph-storage.yaml', 'network/config/three-nics-vlans/controller.yaml'], 'message': 'Add network templates for multiple NICs with flat and VLAN tagged networks

This change adds a set of network interface configurations and an example
environment file for using multiple NICs with both flat and VLAN tagged
networks. These templates assume that nic1 is used for provisioning
(ctlplane), nic2 is used as a VLAN trunk network (br-isolated) for
traffic isolation and nic3 is used for both public/external API traffic
(br-ex).

Change-Id: If7a93c03627a5249c8e5a57a82c3583e45da4621
'}]
commit_message:
Add network templates for multiple NICs with flat and VLAN tagged networks

This change adds a set of network interface configurations and an example
environment file for using multiple NICs with both flat and VLAN tagged
networks. These templates assume that nic1 is used for provisioning
(ctlplane), nic2 is used as a VLAN trunk network (br-isolated) for
traffic isolation and nic3 is used for both public/external API traffic
(br-ex).

Change-Id: If7a93c03627a5249c8e5a57a82c3583e45da4621

subject: Set check_exit_code to False for ifup
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-05 21:00:11.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Set check_exit_code to False for ifup

This change set the check_exit_code to False for ifup,
such that when ifup an interface fails for whatever
reason, os-net-config can continue to bring up other
interfaces.

os-net-config brings up interfaces in a for loop, if
the pxe interface is not the first interface of the
for loop and the ifup of other interfaces fail, exception
will be raised and the pxe interface will never be
brought up, which further breaks the entire openstack
installation.

Change-Id: I7a8a2359db01f545128f550ad5a6d18d8f5a4e40
'}]
commit_message:
Set check_exit_code to False for ifup

This change set the check_exit_code to False for ifup,
such that when ifup an interface fails for whatever
reason, os-net-config can continue to bring up other
interfaces.

os-net-config brings up interfaces in a for loop, if
the pxe interface is not the first interface of the
for loop and the ifup of other interfaces fail, exception
will be raised and the pxe interface will never be
brought up, which further breaks the entire openstack
installation.

Change-Id: I7a8a2359db01f545128f550ad5a6d18d8f5a4e40

subject: Change nova service's name for v3 to novav3.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-05 19:24:27.000000000', 'files': ['os_cloud_config/keystone.py'], 'message': "Change nova service's name for v3 to novav3.

A common convention for naming nova service's name for v3 endpoint is to
use novav3/computev3.  This patch enforce this convention.

It also unlocks a blocker for this patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/234704 where puppet is unable to handle
services only different by type.  This is being fixed here
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238954/ but as it's a backward
incompatible change it may take some time to get to master.

This also fixes the red-hat bugzilla.

Change-Id: Ic5997b237ebe052b6db08508cd7c1e85b2093a1d
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1236989
"}]
commit_message:
Change nova service's name for v3 to novav3.

A common convention for naming nova service's name for v3 endpoint is to
use novav3/computev3.  This patch enforce this convention.

It also unlocks a blocker for this patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/234704 where puppet is unable to handle
services only different by type.  This is being fixed here
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238954/ but as it's a backward
incompatible change it may take some time to get to master.

This also fixes the red-hat bugzilla.

Change-Id: Ic5997b237ebe052b6db08508cd7c1e85b2093a1d
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1236989

commit_message:
Add AMT support

This change adds the last missing part to be able to deploy TripleO
on AMT-based boxes (like the Intel NUC).

NB: Centos/Rhel 7 users are affected by RHBZ#1319949, which needs fixing
when AMT is configured to use unencrypted http.

Change-Id: I46dabb55ed4351e5581be2953b14b7175957a69d
Depends-On: Ide3697bcd9a27da533ba1dbbe04c261efb869701

commit_message:
Amend --ntp-server help message to add support for multiple servers

This commit amends the help message for the --ntp-server flag to mention
that it support a comma separated list of ntp servers.

It also reflect the change in the parameter name from NtpServer to
NtpServers.

Example

openstack overcloud deploy --templates --ntp-server
0.centos.pool.org --ntp-server 1.centos.pool.org

Depends-On: I4925ef1cf1e565d789981e609c88a07b6e9b28de
Change-Id: Ifb3497a025268022791900faced7cd475b3f0840

their script something that won't be executed. Eventually we should
deprecate this and disallow having executable files in .d that aren't

commit_message:
Warn when silently ignoring executable files

This provides a first step to prevent users from accidentally naming
their script something that won't be executed. Eventually we should
deprecate this and disallow having executable files in .d that aren't
going to be executed.

Change-Id: Iec8b877ea1b8338aa20cc14e6e07ba24ca6234cd
Closes-Bug: #1452509

subject: Ensure cinder-volume will survive reboot on PoC deployments
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-29 15:48:38.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller.pp', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': "Ensure cinder-volume will survive reboot on PoC deployments

On PoC deployments reboot of controller means that loopback device
providing cinder-volume won't exist. We need to add service that
recreates it before starting cinder-volume service.

Change-Id: I760e1be40580f49f5fdf28432f9ca97f79f75a2e
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure cinder-volume will survive reboot on PoC deployments

On PoC deployments reboot of controller means that loopback device
providing cinder-volume won't exist. We need to add service that
recreates it before starting cinder-volume service.

Change-Id: I760e1be40580f49f5fdf28432f9ca97f79f75a2e

commit_message:
Don't use guest as rabbitmq user

By default guest user is forbidden to connect to anything else than
 localhost. We should use separate rabbitmq user on overcloud.

Closes-Bug: #1587961

Change-Id: Ic30e73dea06b3fe64e1c16315b2daf45d2a2a15b

commit_message:
Add ability to use NFS as a backend of nova instances

This change introduces the ability to store the nova
instances files on an NFS share. This is done by mounting
the /var/lib/nova/instances directory on the compute nodes
from an NFS location specified in an environment file.

Change-Id: I89c4470c5be4438233c6ea9a629a67b90242598f

subject: Adds support for SRIOV via NeutronMechanismDrivers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-09 21:00:46.000000000', 'files': ['environments/sriov.yaml'], 'message': "Adds support for SRIOV via NeutronMechanismDrivers

This patch is the first step in enabling SR/IOV to be supported
via TripleO. This is usually a completely manual setup, and can
cause problems where 'sriovnicswitch' is removed from the list
of mechanism drivers when a stack-update takes place. This line
could be added to any environment file, but thought it best to
add in separately as it's somewhat uncommon and we need a
placeholder for Nova PCI device lists.

Change-Id: I6993f18f3d1e5815d0d08623b8b120215f15dd9e
"}]
commit_message:
Adds support for SRIOV via NeutronMechanismDrivers

This patch is the first step in enabling SR/IOV to be supported
via TripleO. This is usually a completely manual setup, and can
cause problems where 'sriovnicswitch' is removed from the list
of mechanism drivers when a stack-update takes place. This line
could be added to any environment file, but thought it best to
add in separately as it's somewhat uncommon and we need a
placeholder for Nova PCI device lists.

Change-Id: I6993f18f3d1e5815d0d08623b8b120215f15dd9e

subject: Fixup default open_files_limit for galera
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 13039, 'name': 'Martin André', 'email': 'm.andre@redhat.com', 'username': 'mandre'}, {'_account_id': 15206, 'name': 'Marian Krcmarik', 'email': 'mkrcmari@redhat.com', 'username': 'mvk'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-10 16:01:21.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller.pp', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': "Fixup default open_files_limit for galera

We are currently setting this to -1, which is not a valid
value according to mariadb docs (see bug report below).
This review just makes the value 0, on the assumption that
the -1 was meant to represent 'infinite'. Note that at
least in the pacemaker case we *are* passing 16384 to the
resource arguments with --open-files-limit=16384

Closes-Bug: 1524809

Change-Id: I251cb1995ae083e8d30c3b317151b43d2ba7f073
"}]
commit_message:
Fixup default open_files_limit for galera

We are currently setting this to -1, which is not a valid
value according to mariadb docs (see bug report below).
This review just makes the value 0, on the assumption that
the -1 was meant to represent 'infinite'. Note that at
least in the pacemaker case we *are* passing 16384 to the
resource arguments with --open-files-limit=16384

Closes-Bug: 1524809

Change-Id: I251cb1995ae083e8d30c3b317151b43d2ba7f073

commit_message:
Allow to allow_resize_to_same_host to true in nova

To be able to resize a ephemeral node, we need to set
allow_resize_to_same_host to true in nova.

Default is set to false like OpenStack default.

Closes-bug: #1535669

Change-Id: Ie4c701e16319399b4d1d8b09efc62db30b6e1444
Depends-On: Ib3e0d53c1c219fd6d83f940053b833163c51dcb3
Signed-off-by: Cyril Lopez <cylopez@redhat.com>

subject: Secure the mongodb server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-15 14:26:19.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller.pp', 'puppet/controller.yaml', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp', 'puppet/hieradata/controller.yaml'], 'message': "Secure the mongodb server

In the current state, the mongodb deployed on the overcloud is wide open
to any connection from within the network it is listening on.

This review aims to secure the mongodb deployed in the overcloud by
doing few things :

  * Creating a 'root' account
  * Creating a ceilometer account that can only connect to the
    ceilometer db.
  * Enabling authentication mechanism (MONGODB-CR)

Change-Id: I66a5709c9b564c76e136589dd9b934066e01e396
"}]
commit_message:
Secure the mongodb server

In the current state, the mongodb deployed on the overcloud is wide open
to any connection from within the network it is listening on.

This review aims to secure the mongodb deployed in the overcloud by
doing few things :

  * Creating a 'root' account
  * Creating a ceilometer account that can only connect to the
    ceilometer db.
  * Enabling authentication mechanism (MONGODB-CR)

Change-Id: I66a5709c9b564c76e136589dd9b934066e01e396

commit_message:
WIP: Optimize startup by pulling images ahead of time

By pulling one container, we can accelerate the startup of
the compute node.  We added a new variable for the nova compute
image.  This could be swapped out for the base image when we add in
the controller.

Change-Id: Ifdf4b55e24bb0eafc26f2c76b7330df13f9d5ee0
Signed-off-by: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-by: Ryan Hallisey <rhallise@redhat.com>

subject: Docker controller role configured via Puppet
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-24 21:03:52.000000000', 'files': ['environments/docker-rdo.yaml', 'docker/controller-post.yaml', 'docker/firstboot/start_docker_agents.sh'], 'message': 'Docker controller role configured via Puppet

Add a containerized controller node in the overcloud.
Configuration files are generated via OpenStack Puppet modules
which are then used to externally configure kolla containers for
each OpenStack service.

This uses Centos AtomicOS as a base operating system and requires that we bootstrap
the image with a container which contains the required os-collect-config agent
hooks to support running puppet, shell scripts, and docker compose.

Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I520328899418a7fc022d05f805298ea12e85e222
'}]
commit_message:
Docker controller role configured via Puppet

Add a containerized controller node in the overcloud.
Configuration files are generated via OpenStack Puppet modules
which are then used to externally configure kolla containers for
each OpenStack service.

This uses Centos AtomicOS as a base operating system and requires that we bootstrap
the image with a container which contains the required os-collect-config agent
hooks to support running puppet, shell scripts, and docker compose.

Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I520328899418a7fc022d05f805298ea12e85e222

subject: Make the NeutronMechanismDrivers into a proper list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-19 08:12:28.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml', 'controller.yaml', 'compute.yaml', 'puppet/compute-puppet.yaml', 'puppet/controller-puppet.yaml'], 'message': "Make the NeutronMechanismDrivers into a proper list

The NeutronMechanismDrivers parameter was defined as a string
when it should be a list as per Kilo docs @ [1].

The proposed cisco driver patches at [2] are using the resulting
hiera data (which we do pass even though it hasn't to date been
consumed and applied, see [3]) to set ml2 configuration appropriate
to their needs.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/kilo/config-reference/content/networking-options-plugins-ml2.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/198754/10/puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp
[3] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1254897

Change-Id: If1434f094b5ccdc20cb24f7b41d8c8309c664744
"}]
commit_message:
Make the NeutronMechanismDrivers into a proper list

The NeutronMechanismDrivers parameter was defined as a string
when it should be a list as per Kilo docs @ [1].

The proposed cisco driver patches at [2] are using the resulting
hiera data (which we do pass even though it hasn't to date been
consumed and applied, see [3]) to set ml2 configuration appropriate
to their needs.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/kilo/config-reference/content/networking-options-plugins-ml2.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/198754/10/puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp
[3] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1254897

Change-Id: If1434f094b5ccdc20cb24f7b41d8c8309c664744

commit_message:
Allow the database password to be configurable

Currently we have one password for
all service databases and that password
is not configurable. This change makes
this password configurable.

(Eventually we need to move to one
configurable password per service database, this
is a step towards this)

This change is for both undercloud and overcloud

Change-Id: I3e85b96972ae1b2b245513b76104fd92cac12542

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-11-28 20:21:36.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py'], 'message': 'Lock in DHCP agent based on network_id

All cache operations and dnsmasq process operations
are scoped to a network ID so we can always safely
perform concurrent actions on different network IDs.
This patch adjusts the DHCP agent to lock based on
network ID rather than having a global lock for every
operation.

sync_state calls are still protected with a reader/writer
lock to ensure that when sync_state needs to run, all
other operations are blocked.

Related-Bug: #1548190
Change-Id: I56010dc801d82be56f12e834c5164316872c2f8b
'}]
commit_message:
Lock in DHCP agent based on network_id

All cache operations and dnsmasq process operations
are scoped to a network ID so we can always safely
perform concurrent actions on different network IDs.
This patch adjusts the DHCP agent to lock based on
network ID rather than having a global lock for every
operation.

sync_state calls are still protected with a reader/writer
lock to ensure that when sync_state needs to run, all
other operations are blocked.

Related-Bug: #1548190
Change-Id: I56010dc801d82be56f12e834c5164316872c2f8b

commit_message:
Added retries for db_sync

If db sync fails, it is never retried leading to errors. So, this
patch adds retries for db_sync to avoid sync fails.

Change-Id: Ieb5f39dbc53bb7a1a2031eb139bb3d8cda579cb4
Closes-Bug: #1628580

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-28 11:55:15.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Resize an existing disk

The soon to be deleted `Image.cache` method used to skip the
`create_image` call if the disk already existed, and instead just resize
& preallocate. Extract that functionality into `Image.resize`, so that
driver can explicitly do the same in the disk already exists case.

Co-authored-by: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>
Implements: bp/imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: I8485479cd3f6829c1d7cdf0a1001592e77f720b5
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Resize an existing disk

The soon to be deleted `Image.cache` method used to skip the
`create_image` call if the disk already existed, and instead just resize
& preallocate. Extract that functionality into `Image.resize`, so that
driver can explicitly do the same in the disk already exists case.

Co-authored-by: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>
Implements: bp/imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: I8485479cd3f6829c1d7cdf0a1001592e77f720b5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-29 12:49:11.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh', 'functions.sh'], 'message': 'grenade: Distinguish base/target branch override

This change allows to use grenade with the following scenario:

* checkout stable/mitaka for all projects except for one we want
stable/foobar
* upgrade all projects to master expect one to stable/foobar-next

The current OVERRIDE_$PROJECT_PROJECT_BRANCH concept set the branch
for the old and the new workspace. When for this scenario we want a
different branch for both workspace.

Change-Id: I41250e61949d3fe3e6dfede8d28eb75fc133bb34
'}]
commit_message:
grenade: Distinguish base/target branch override

This change allows to use grenade with the following scenario:

* checkout stable/mitaka for all projects except for one we want
stable/foobar
* upgrade all projects to master expect one to stable/foobar-next

The current OVERRIDE_$PROJECT_PROJECT_BRANCH concept set the branch
for the old and the new workspace. When for this scenario we want a
different branch for both workspace.

Change-Id: I41250e61949d3fe3e6dfede8d28eb75fc133bb34

subject: Disable SSH verification on mons online check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-06 15:28:43.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/ceph_get_mon_host.yml'], 'message': "Disable SSH verification on mons online check

Since we are only trying to find out whether the host is online
at this point it is not necessary to perform host key verification,
since the SSH command being used does not mirror the ansible
setting of host_key_checking. If ansible host_key_checking is
enabled then the set_fact task below is likely to be skipped due
to:

u'stderr': u'Host key verification failed.', u'rc': 255

Change-Id: Ib4c2043219670f0753e76d330a2316cae10751f1
"}]
commit_message:
Disable SSH verification on mons online check

Since we are only trying to find out whether the host is online
at this point it is not necessary to perform host key verification,
since the SSH command being used does not mirror the ansible
setting of host_key_checking. If ansible host_key_checking is
enabled then the set_fact task below is likely to be skipped due
to:

u'stderr': u'Host key verification failed.', u'rc': 255

Change-Id: Ib4c2043219670f0753e76d330a2316cae10751f1

commit_message:
Add custom interfaces file and update docs for PowerVM RMC

This patch adds templating a custom Nova interfaces file for PowerVM only
to support doing mixed IPV4-only and IPV6-only deployments. It also adds
documentation for configuration of PowerVM RMC.

Change-Id: Ib1ff51c95998bbc3183ea9b896dc8fa2dfbc0435
Closes-Bug: #1643988

subject: Adds auto-detection for VIP interfaces
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 20:38:13.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/keepalived.pp', 'manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'message': "Adds auto-detection for VIP interfaces

Previously the ctrl plane VIP would default to 'br-ex' which in non-vlan
deployments ends up being the wrong interface.  The public VIP interface
was also defaulted to 'br-ex' which would be incorrect for vlan based
deployments.  Since a user has already given the nic template (and in
most cases the subnet that corresponds to the nic) the installer should
be able to figure out which interface the public/control vip should be
on.

These changes enable that type of auto-detection, unless a user
explicitly overrides the heat parameters for ControlVirtualInterface and
PublicVirtualInterface.  Also removes calling keepalived from haproxy
now that the services are composed separately on the Controller role.

Partial-Bug: 1606632

Change-Id: I05105fce85be8ace986db351cdca2916f405ed04
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 87763459ae57614e092f772595a03e7d552f96d1)
"}]
commit_message:
Adds auto-detection for VIP interfaces

Previously the ctrl plane VIP would default to 'br-ex' which in non-vlan
deployments ends up being the wrong interface.  The public VIP interface
was also defaulted to 'br-ex' which would be incorrect for vlan based
deployments.  Since a user has already given the nic template (and in
most cases the subnet that corresponds to the nic) the installer should
be able to figure out which interface the public/control vip should be
on.

These changes enable that type of auto-detection, unless a user
explicitly overrides the heat parameters for ControlVirtualInterface and
PublicVirtualInterface.  Also removes calling keepalived from haproxy
now that the services are composed separately on the Controller role.

Partial-Bug: 1606632

Change-Id: I05105fce85be8ace986db351cdca2916f405ed04
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 87763459ae57614e092f772595a03e7d552f96d1)

subject: Fix cluster relation unnecessary service restarts
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-05 15:35:06.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_cinder_utils.py', 'hooks/cinder_utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix cluster relation unnecessary service restarts

The logic introduced in commit 619ce065 to formalise database
initialisation did not support the leader switching and re-runs
of the shared-db relation. This resulted in extraneous service
restarts. We avoid this by adding some extra logic around this
code.

Change-Id: If988331e552da930eff868abded323014fd50f04
Closes-Bug: 1561927
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cluster relation unnecessary service restarts

The logic introduced in commit 619ce065 to formalise database
initialisation did not support the leader switching and re-runs
of the shared-db relation. This resulted in extraneous service
restarts. We avoid this by adding some extra logic around this
code.

Change-Id: If988331e552da930eff868abded323014fd50f04
Closes-Bug: 1561927

commit_message:
[docs][5] Re-design docs to cover all user-groups

First pack of changes in upcoming chain to redesign Rally docs.
All information related to Rally plugins separated and refactored.
Modified files fit 80 symbols margin where possible.

[TODO] continue with other parts of the docs:
       - Contribute to Rally
       - Request New Features
       - Project Info
[TODO] add 80 symbols margin check similar to what
       Performance Documentation has

Change-Id: I5d19a2bbbcdd9be463793bce50de62c5608b6157

commit_message:
add host to vif.py set_config_* functions

- This change extends the function signture
  of the vif.py set_config_* functions to
  optionally accepth the host object.
- This is required to support host specifc
  features that depend on the vif type chosen
  e.g. vhost-user and multiqueue

Change-Id: I9b116f64864863ade32a99fcda9051b60ff7fbde

commit_message:
Fix placement API version history 1.1 title

This needs to use dashes otherwise it doesn't render
properly in the docs. Also adds an informative title
for the 1.1 microversion since that seems to be a pattern
we're going with now in 1.2.

commit_message:
placement: Perform build list of standard classes once

To prevent rebuilding list of standard resource classes every time
destroy() method is called on ResourceClass object, move it to class
attribute. Also, removed get_standards call in destroy method of
ResourceClass, and simply access list through the cache object.

Change-Id: I3569bd5479966dfd895b31c77a74cc8e9ad5493a
blueprint: custom-resource-classes

This patch adds support for a REST API for CRUD operations on custom
resource classes:

    GET /resource_classes: return all resource classes
    POST /resource_classes: create a new custom resource class
    PUT /resource_classes/{name}: update name of custom resource class
    DELETE /resource_classes/{name}: deletes a custom resource class

commit_message:
placement: REST API for resource classes

This patch adds support for a REST API for CRUD operations on custom
resource classes:

    GET /resource_classes: return all resource classes
    POST /resource_classes: create a new custom resource class
    PUT /resource_classes/{name}: update name of custom resource class
    DELETE /resource_classes/{name}: deletes a custom resource class
    GET /resource_classes/{name}: get a single resource class

Change-Id: I99e7bcfe27938e5e4d50ac3005690ac1255d4c5e
blueprint: custom-resource-classes

commit_message:
Add and document devmode.sh to wrap full-deploy.sh

This new script can be used by developer to create a full testing
environment from the master-tripleo-ci images, optionally including
changes either from a previous Zuul run or from Jenkins.

subject: Avoid converting to unicode if not needed
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-12-05 19:08:57.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py', 'oslo_log/handlers.py'], 'message': "Avoid converting to unicode if not needed

In python3, str is already represents unicode data. The current code
called oslo.utils safe_encode irrespective of incoming message encoding
and encoded it to 'utf-8', however that resolves to a byte string.

Since the syslog module expects a message of type unicode[1]. We don't
need to encode if python3 is being used, since the string representation
is sequence of unicode codepoints by default.

[1] https://hg.python.org/cpython/file/tip/Modules/syslogmodule.c#l162

Change-Id: Id40854d6b762b2d639afd7168ddb3a1e728d13d7
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid converting to unicode if not needed

In python3, str is already represents unicode data. The current code
called oslo.utils safe_encode irrespective of incoming message encoding
and encoded it to 'utf-8', however that resolves to a byte string.

Since the syslog module expects a message of type unicode[1]. We don't
need to encode if python3 is being used, since the string representation
is sequence of unicode codepoints by default.

[1] https://hg.python.org/cpython/file/tip/Modules/syslogmodule.c#l162

Change-Id: Id40854d6b762b2d639afd7168ddb3a1e728d13d7

subject: Default use_stderr to False

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-18 03:16:51.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/_options.py', 'releasenotes/notes/use_stderr_default_false-50d846b88cf2be90.yaml'], 'message': 'Default use_stderr to False

While defaulting use_stderr to True might be a useful development
default, it is not useful for operators. Operators using systemd,
upstart, or any of these kinds of services, will find that if they
specify --log-file they will have two copies of the same logs on their
disk:

- one in the service log (e.g., /var/log/upstart)
- one in the log file they specify with --log-file

Instead of operators having to disable stderr log in every
configuration, we should just default it to False here.

Closes-bug #1588051

Change-Id: I85f8670d98d03101888fb7bb0c89eb809719b4e8
'}]
commit_message:
Default use_stderr to False

While defaulting use_stderr to True might be a useful development
default, it is not useful for operators. Operators using systemd,
upstart, or any of these kinds of services, will find that if they
specify --log-file they will have two copies of the same logs on their
disk:

- one in the service log (e.g., /var/log/upstart)
- one in the log file they specify with --log-file

Instead of operators having to disable stderr log in every
configuration, we should just default it to False here.

Closes-bug #1588051

Change-Id: I85f8670d98d03101888fb7bb0c89eb809719b4e8

commit_message:
Provide Murano Apps mocks

Current set of mocks covers the following UI API calls:

* GET /apps?limit=10
* GET /apps/?limit=10&packageOffset=<packageId>&appOffset=<appFqn>

Due to issues with asynchronously getting json with stubbed data and
initializing $httpBackend expectations simultaneously in the
module.run() phase, stubbed data was itself implemented as an Angular
service (though it's ugly).

Implements blueprint: schema-driven-ui
Change-Id: I3f91ad6d73674a8a15d1fd809713414fad95f353

This patch finishes the rework of murano-dashboard assets by
reorganizing css files:

  that page body-id, which is set in the corresponding template;
* css rules which do not have explicit use are @imported under
  #murano-common id which is set for all non-specific templates;
* specific templates still have all the css rules from 'common' murano

The above solution is not ideal, but would allow to use a single css

Change-Id: Id850063987f7980763a473eb27881bea6938d071

commit_message:
Compress murano-dashboard css assets within a common context

This patch finishes the rework of murano-dashboard assets by
reorganizing css files:
* now they are scss files to use the @import statement;
* each page's set to dedicated css rules is an @import nested under
  that page body-id, which is set in the corresponding template;
* css rules which do not have explicit use are @imported under
  #murano-common id which is set for all non-specific templates;
* specific templates still have all the css rules from 'common' murano
  set.

The above solution is not ideal, but would allow to use a single css
file for murano-dashboard, and remove custom css rules at some point
in future.

Closes-Bug: #1603307
Change-Id: Id850063987f7980763a473eb27881bea6938d071

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-23 17:29:27.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/templates/packages/modify_package.html', 'muranodashboard/templates/services/wizard_create.html', 'muranodashboard/templates/murano_base.html', 'muranodashboard/templates/deployments/index.html', 'muranodashboard/templates/images/index.html', 'muranodashboard/local/enabled/_50_murano.py', 'muranodashboard/templates/categories/add.html', 'muranodashboard/templates/images/mark.html', 'muranodashboard/templates/deployments/reports.html', 'muranodashboard/templates/packages/import_bundle.html', 'muranodashboard/templates/packages/upload.html', 'muranodashboard/templates/packages/index.html', 'muranodashboard/templates/catalog/index.html', 'muranodashboard/templates/environments/index.html', 'muranodashboard/templates/categories/index.html', 'muranodashboard/templates/catalog/app_details.html', 'muranodashboard/templates/services/details.html', 'muranodashboard/templates/environments/create.html', 'muranodashboard/templates/services/index.html'], 'message': "Compress murano-dashboard JS scripts within a common context

Post-compressor signal relies on a presence of the 'THEME' key in
template context, which is very likely missing due to murano-dashboard
compressing its assets in its own way, without delegating this task to
openstack_dashboard base.html template.

This patch moves all murano-dashboard JS scripts to ADD_JS_FILES
setting and gets rid of murano_base.html template which sole purpose
is including these scripts.

Change-Id: I408e383fa2139dd183550e35f2c74559708b0369
Partial-Bug: #1603307
"}]
commit_message:
Compress murano-dashboard JS scripts within a common context

Post-compressor signal relies on a presence of the 'THEME' key in
template context, which is very likely missing due to murano-dashboard
compressing its assets in its own way, without delegating this task to
openstack_dashboard base.html template.

This patch moves all murano-dashboard JS scripts to ADD_JS_FILES
setting and gets rid of murano_base.html template which sole purpose
is including these scripts.

Change-Id: I408e383fa2139dd183550e35f2c74559708b0369
Partial-Bug: #1603307

Move all logic related to the package upload to a separate function

This will allow to call this function both from legacy Django wizard
process_step() method, and as a separate REST API call (backed by
Django as of now) to be used by new Angular 'Import Package' wizard.

commit_message:
Implement basic features of NG Packages table

* New drawer table of packages with magic search filtering by Name and
  Type
* Two actions implemented: Import Package and Delete Package

All needed Django REST API endpoints were implemented along the
way. The location of angular murano services is changed to
app/core/openstack-service-api/murano.service.js, to make it aligned
with other OpenStack services in standard NG Horizon dashboard.

Change-Id: I0109221992686c5a93d172f47d3b47d7b0d6b897

subject: Update Protection Plugin Spec
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-27 16:05:26.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/specs/pluggable_protection_provider.rst', 'doc/images/protection-service/hooks.png', 'doc/images/protection-service/activities-links.png'], 'message': 'Update Protection Plugin Spec

Change activities into hooks, and split the pre hook into prepare_begin
and prepare_finish, in order to enable a scenario like:
1. VM quiesce
2. Volume snapshot
3. VM Unquiesce
4. Volume Backup
5. Volume delete snapshot

Change-Id: Ide80a6de2bd60961af14bd5ea226bbf355d8e19e
'}]
commit_message:
Update Protection Plugin Spec

Change activities into hooks, and split the pre hook into prepare_begin
and prepare_finish, in order to enable a scenario like:
1. VM quiesce
2. Volume snapshot
3. VM Unquiesce
4. Volume Backup
5. Volume delete snapshot

Change-Id: Ide80a6de2bd60961af14bd5ea226bbf355d8e19e

commit_message:
Remove the -d flag to libvirtd when using systemd

If using systemd the -d flag will cause the service to always run
and the service start/stop will not properly manage the daemon.

This should make sure the behavior is not changed when using
upstart.

Change-Id: I9d9d98c92b977965b73c10ce37e4b8896723f2bf
Closes-Bug: 1647637

commit_message:

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-06 07:38:37.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_utils/tests/test_uuidutils.py', 'oslo_utils/uuidutils.py'], 'message': "Add toggle 'dashed' to 'generate_uuid' function

commit_message:
Add toggle 'dashed' to 'generate_uuid' function

Enable 'generate_uuid' function to generate uuid with dashes or not,
because some projects use uuid with dashes while some others not.

Change-Id: I6f213ea47de5713a79b5e0dccf486a7bba88f853

commit_message:
Use ExtensionDescriptor from neutron-lib

Adopt the class rehomed in https://review.openstack.org/389825

This change impacts subprojects that use ExtensionDescriptor from
neutron core. All subprojects should switch to using the class
directly from neutron-lib.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I0da90fb9d27a0a2008b60e56ed69bc9b9ae63c3e

revisions:
[{'number': 33, 'created': '2016-11-29 08:57:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: virtlogd: use virtlogd for char devices

This change makes actual usage of the "logd" sub-element for char devices.
The two REST APIs ``os-getConsoleOutput`` and ``os-getSerialConsole`` can
now be satisfied at the same time. This is valid for any combination of:
* char device element: "console", "serial"
* char device type: "tcp", "pty"
There is also no need to create multiple different device types anymore.
If we have a tcp device, we don't need the pty device anymore. The logging
will be done in the tcp device.

Implements blueprint libvirt-virtlogd
Closes-Bug: 832507
Change-Id: I7bab3c0474da63ab283dac5963a520995cea41d2
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: virtlogd: use virtlogd for char devices

This change makes actual usage of the "logd" sub-element for char devices.
The two REST APIs ``os-getConsoleOutput`` and ``os-getSerialConsole`` can
now be satisfied at the same time. This is valid for any combination of:
* char device element: "console", "serial"
* char device type: "tcp", "pty"
There is also no need to create multiple different device types anymore.
If we have a tcp device, we don't need the pty device anymore. The logging
will be done in the tcp device.

Implements blueprint libvirt-virtlogd
Closes-Bug: 832507
Change-Id: I7bab3c0474da63ab283dac5963a520995cea41d2

* do not display time_start and time_end transaction attributes

* display transaction name instead of graph_type

commit_message:
Fix duplicate declaration

User configures Username(root) and Home directory(/root) in
Operating System Access, and will throw the error that
Credentials_file[/root/openrc] is already declared in deployment.

Change-Id: I6f437550edd78af372e5f52b55663beab86edfee
Closes-Bug: #1636472
(cherry picked from commit 12769a9127b438c324a2c4189a7db61aa3f958d2)

commit_message:
Remove allow_pagination and allow_sorting config options

They were deprecated in Newton. This patch cleans them up.

Note: it does not mean that the features will not work anymore. On the
contrary, now API will consistently sort and paginate for plugins that
honour the relevant sorting/pagination parameters.

Note2: base resource controller still allows to pass
allow_pagination=False and allow_sorting=False parameters to disable the
features if a registered plugin does not support the features yet.

Change-Id: I5fd30b20f645846d9366740372c4815c4b33e2eb
Related-Bug: #1566514

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and

commit_message:
Add default-tenant-network-type config option

- Add default-tenant-network-type config option to allow the default
  network type for a tenant network to be set

- Fix rendering of overlay-network-type so that an empty string is
  valid

Change-Id: Ib2325d273a0dd5e637f36113b951130387902777
Closes-Bug: 1533651

This spec provides a gap analysis of what is required for the Glance
project to assert the various rolling upgrade tags and specifies the
actions necessary to close the gaps.

Co-authored-by: Hemanth Makkapati <hemanth.makkapati@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Glance rolling upgrades

This spec provides a gap analysis of what is required for the Glance
project to assert the various rolling upgrade tags and specifies the
actions necessary to close the gaps.

Change-Id: I40c2b85e9d9a806d528d5be5d97ca8a730631463
Co-authored-by: Hemanth Makkapati <hemanth.makkapati@rackspace.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <brian.rosmaita@rackspace.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9414, 'name': 'zhongshengping', 'email': 'chdzsp@163.com', 'username': 'ZhongShengping'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 15519, 'name': 'Iury Gregory Melo Ferreira', 'display_name': 'Iury Gregory', 'email': 'iurygregory@gmail.com', 'username': 'iurygregory'}, {'_account_id': 17070, 'name': 'Xiaohua Yuan', 'email': 'yuanxiaohuaeva@gmail.com', 'username': 'xiaohua'}, {'_account_id': 18795, 'name': 'mkarpin', 'email': 'mkarpin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'nkarpin'}, {'_account_id': 21748, 'name': 'Michal Adamczyk', 'email': 'vanditboy@gmail.com', 'username': 'vanditboy'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-12-02 22:34:58.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/xenserver-8eb20faa5f230dfd.yaml', 'manifests/compute/xenserver.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_compute_xenserver_spec.rb'], 'message': 'XenServer patch

As OpenStack + XenServer deployment is not that common as KVM. This
patch contains class parameters update and all parameters to
allow configure OpenStack with XenServer more easily. It covers
parameters needed for non-DHCP network deployment with flat network
config injection (same as Rackspace).

Deployment guides for OpenStack + XenServer can be found here:

https://www.citrix.com/blogs/2015/11/30/integrating-xenserver-rdo-and-neutron/
http://openstack-xenserver.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

Change-Id: Ib8185f6dcd6153473e820973049f234f7f7d3cfd
'}]
commit_message:
XenServer patch

As OpenStack + XenServer deployment is not that common as KVM. This
patch contains class parameters update and all parameters to
allow configure OpenStack with XenServer more easily. It covers
parameters needed for non-DHCP network deployment with flat network
config injection (same as Rackspace).

Deployment guides for OpenStack + XenServer can be found here:

https://www.citrix.com/blogs/2015/11/30/integrating-xenserver-rdo-and-neutron/
http://openstack-xenserver.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

Change-Id: Ib8185f6dcd6153473e820973049f234f7f7d3cfd

subject: [UG] Add description of `delete graph` command
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-06 10:10:38.000000000', 'files': ['userdocs/fuel-user-guide/maintain-environment/workflows-manage/run-workflows.rst', 'userdocs/fuel-user-guide/maintain-environment/workflows-manage.rst', 'userdocs/fuel-user-guide/configure-environment/workflows.rst', 'userdocs/fuel-user-guide/maintain-environment/workflows-manage/delete-workflows.rst', 'userdocs/fuel-user-guide/cli/cli_workflows.rst', 'userdocs/fuel-user-guide/maintain-environment/workflows-manage/download-workflows.rst', 'userdocs/fuel-user-guide/cli/cli_graphs.rst', 'userdocs/fuel-user-guide/maintain-environment/workflows-manage/upload-workflows.rst', 'userdocs/fuel-user-guide/cli.rst', 'userdocs/fuel-user-guide/maintain-environment/workflows-manage/view-history.rst'], 'message': "[UG] Add description of `delete graph` command

This patch:

- adds the description of the `fuel2 delete graph` command
  to the corresponding sub-section of Fuel CLI section;
- adds steps on how to delete a deployment workflow
  to the Manage workflows sub-section of the Maintain your
  env section;
- changes the following parameters as preferable in
  fuel2 CLI where applicable: '--env' to '-e',
  '--type' to '-t', '--release' to '-r', '--plugin' to '-p',
  '--all' to '-a', '--cluster' to 'c';
- renames 'graph' to 'workflow';
- fixes noticed typos.

Change-Id: I2e88436792d812ba60f5189c4a572d680ed0ae21
Closes-Bug: #1633773
(cherry picked from commit 51ac33c003e683bd169191410408b8a2f0c56985)
"}]
commit_message:
[UG] Add description of `delete graph` command

This patch:

- adds the description of the `fuel2 delete graph` command
  to the corresponding sub-section of Fuel CLI section;
- adds steps on how to delete a deployment workflow
  to the Manage workflows sub-section of the Maintain your
  env section;
- changes the following parameters as preferable in
  fuel2 CLI where applicable: '--env' to '-e',
  '--type' to '-t', '--release' to '-r', '--plugin' to '-p',
  '--all' to '-a', '--cluster' to 'c';
- renames 'graph' to 'workflow';
- fixes noticed typos.

Change-Id: I2e88436792d812ba60f5189c4a572d680ed0ae21
Closes-Bug: #1633773
(cherry picked from commit 51ac33c003e683bd169191410408b8a2f0c56985)

commit_message:
tests: fix breakage of oslo.db 4.15.0

new oslo.db force test_migration to use the provision system
that we don't want. Since we create and cleanup the engine ourself.
We can mock the provisioning system like we do for oslo.db<=4.14.0 for
self.db.

Related-bug: #1647280

Change-Id: Ida22e8a58a8f7b2fbe6ba9dc32a6dcb0d99d7c61

subject: Use default domain context when listing multidomain users
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-08-25 10:48:29.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/users/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/users/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/users/tables.py'], 'message': "Use default domain context when listing multidomain users

In Identity->Users, if multidomain support is enabled and no domain
context has been explicitly selected, attempting to list the users will
make Keystone return a 401 Unauthorized error, which in turn results
in Horizon assuming that the token expired and logging out the user.

Because it's not possible to distinguish that error from a legitimate
token expiry (it should probably be 403 Forbidden instead), I'm adding
a check before we call Keystone, and use the default domain for the
context if none was selected by the user.

In addition, all the tests assumed that no context is selected, and only
worked because they mocked the Keystone calls (real Keystone returns an
error in that case). So I had to make the tests use a default domain
instead.

Change-Id: I2a02ce11c76176bd99c8d67ed10fc09696fddcf6
Closes-Bug: #1415588
"}]
commit_message:
Use default domain context when listing multidomain users

In Identity->Users, if multidomain support is enabled and no domain
context has been explicitly selected, attempting to list the users will
make Keystone return a 401 Unauthorized error, which in turn results
in Horizon assuming that the token expired and logging out the user.

Because it's not possible to distinguish that error from a legitimate
token expiry (it should probably be 403 Forbidden instead), I'm adding
a check before we call Keystone, and use the default domain for the
context if none was selected by the user.

In addition, all the tests assumed that no context is selected, and only
worked because they mocked the Keystone calls (real Keystone returns an
error in that case). So I had to make the tests use a default domain
instead.

Change-Id: I2a02ce11c76176bd99c8d67ed10fc09696fddcf6
Closes-Bug: #1415588

commit_message:
Replace 'parse_int_param' with 'get_positive_int'

The old utility function was designed for API request validation
(mainly). Now with API requests validated using jsonschema, the old
function becomes heavy-weight. This patch is an optimization.

Change-Id: Ieaeb068924984e1cb8d9763383dbc62903b1ea47

commit_message:
Don't install zaqarclient on upgrades

The zaqarclient installation doesn't harm anything but at the same time
it's not necessary anymore, so we can remove it. It was needed only for
K->L upgrade.

Add volume_connectors and volume_targets to task

Adding volume_connectors and volume_targets to the task object
to allow for matching the existing model leveraged by ports and
portgroups which allows for simplified storage_interface use.

commit_message:
Define common function to download files

Add function to download file from specific URL that's integrated with
OFFLINE flag.
It will download file only when it not exists or there is newer version
of same file. Useful for local development.
Move installing and cleaning Go to separate function.

Change-Id: Ia2b5efc0d82366c6ad75e688512df9606cb2f1ed

commit_message:
mistral-dashboard: added action executions screens

 * Added 3 new action executions screens: index, overview, and update dialog
 * Added "type" attribute to task screens, followed by a corresponding link
 * Fixed breadcrumbs issue in detail screens following Horizon Newton change
 * Added state label design to detail screens
 * Added design to boolean fields

 * Screenshots: http://pho.to/AXApU

Implements blueprint: mistral-dashboard-action-execution-screens
Implements blueprint: dashboard-detail-screens-improvements
Partially implements blueprint: refactor-execution-link-in-task-executions-screens
Closes-Bug: #1642246

Change-Id: I4c270b2b23d548d4e1cb7e8507e804e44e27c88f

commit_message:
Correct minor issues in test schema

The JSONSchema used to validate the token response had a couple of
issues:

- The domain property schema was wrapped in a domain property
- 'bind' in optional was always present already so no need to add it
  again.

Change-Id: I512e5a041c6ba96fbff71fac1bfdde02f888a582

subject: Fix local check factory bug
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-02 21:44:06.000000000', 'files': ['hacking/core.py', 'hacking/tests/test_local.py'], 'message': 'Fix local check factory bug

The landing of [1] introduced an issue whereupon local
checks were registered after the options had already been
populated with pep8 checks (see patch); resulting in the
checks not running. Instead, the checks can be "refreshed"
by getting them from a pep8 StyleGuide and updating on
the options.

A unit test is also included that verifies the options are updated
with the latest checks from a pep8 StyleGuide object.

This change was in my workspace/testing for [1], but somehow
was left out of the patch commit. I'm still investigating what
happened and am very humbled.

If reviewers don't agree to this patch, then we should revert
[1] and re-release openstack-dev/hacking. Note that openstack
projects should not yet be consuming hacking 0.13.0 [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/397940/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/405583/

Change-Id: I081a0551c663ae661fd3c1b527ddc492bef9b2b1
'}]
commit_message:
Fix local check factory bug

The landing of [1] introduced an issue whereupon local
checks were registered after the options had already been
populated with pep8 checks (see patch); resulting in the
checks not running. Instead, the checks can be "refreshed"
by getting them from a pep8 StyleGuide and updating on
the options.

A unit test is also included that verifies the options are updated
with the latest checks from a pep8 StyleGuide object.

This change was in my workspace/testing for [1], but somehow
was left out of the patch commit. I'm still investigating what
happened and am very humbled.

If reviewers don't agree to this patch, then we should revert
[1] and re-release openstack-dev/hacking. Note that openstack
projects should not yet be consuming hacking 0.13.0 [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/397940/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/405583/

Change-Id: I081a0551c663ae661fd3c1b527ddc492bef9b2b1

subject: Add {global,service}_merged_config_settings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-06 11:38:31.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/services.yaml', 'puppet/services/services.yaml', 'overcloud.j2.yaml'], 'message': 'Add {global,service}_merged_config_settings

These are is a config_settings hashes with a twist: they're deep-merged
to the first level (arrays get merged, lists get joined). This can be
helpful for avoiding workarounds whenever we need to collect some
information from multiple services, e.g.:

data:
  - firewall_rules:
      '10_abc':
        dport: 80
    ceph_pools: ['admin', 'openstack']

  - firewall_rules:
      '20_def':
        dport: 8080
    ceph_pools: ['manila']

will get processed into:

{
    "ceph_pools": [
        "admin",
        "openstack",
        "manila"
    ],
    "firewall_rules": {
        "10_abc": {
            "dport": 80
        },
        "20_def": {
            "dport": 8080
        }
    }
}

Change-Id: I2aeed772a3358c862b2142f3134a7869814164e3
'}]
commit_message:
Add {global,service}_merged_config_settings

These are is a config_settings hashes with a twist: they're deep-merged
to the first level (arrays get merged, lists get joined). This can be
helpful for avoiding workarounds whenever we need to collect some
information from multiple services, e.g.:

data:
  - firewall_rules:
      '10_abc':
        dport: 80
    ceph_pools: ['admin', 'openstack']

  - firewall_rules:
      '20_def':
        dport: 8080
    ceph_pools: ['manila']

will get processed into:

{
    "ceph_pools": [
        "admin",
        "openstack",
        "manila"
    ],
    "firewall_rules": {
        "10_abc": {
            "dport": 80
        },
        "20_def": {
            "dport": 8080
        }
    }
}

Change-Id: I2aeed772a3358c862b2142f3134a7869814164e3
